revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-09 21:19:26.000000000', 'message': 'Only return plans if available from the message

There appears to be a race condition in the list_deployment_plans such
that if another message is recieved before the plan results, we attempt
to return the plans payload which may not exist. This change adds a
check to ensure the payload contains plans before trying to return the
values.

Change-Id: I58da6f699fe8257e3ddb89cd3516889944c4ad92
Closes-Bug: #1802592
'}]
commit_message:
Only return plans if available from the message

There appears to be a race condition in the list_deployment_plans such
that if another message is recieved before the plan results, we attempt
to return the plans payload which may not exist. This change adds a
check to ensure the payload contains plans before trying to return the
values.

Change-Id: I58da6f699fe8257e3ddb89cd3516889944c4ad92
Closes-Bug: #1802592

subject: Mask password when specified as an argument with a space
messages: [{'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-09-19 00:34:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-09-19 03:34:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-11-02 21:18:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-11-12 13:48:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-19 00:34:03.000000000', 'message': 'Mask password when specified as an argument with a space

I was using a command line like

 $ openstack user password set --password "p" --original-password="x"

and saw the --password argument echoed in the info log

 START with options: ['-v', ..., 'user', 'password', 'set', '--password', 'p', '--original-password=***']

The masking works if you set "--password=p", but not "--password p".
This is because the password matching regex doesn't know they're
related.  An easy way to avoid this is to just make the whole log line
back into a single string, and this gets masked correctly.

Change-Id: I0fdd895c9449d9a90d811af4ded34f32ba2b2215
'}, {'created': '2018-09-19 03:34:12.000000000', 'message': 'Mask password when specified as an argument with a space

I was using a command line like

 $ openstack user password set --password "p" --original-password="x"

and saw the --password argument echoed in the info log

 START with options: ['-v', ..., 'user', 'password', 'set', '--password', 'p', '--original-password=***']

The masking works if you set "--password=p", but not "--password p".
This is because the password matching regex doesn't know they're
related.  An easy way to avoid this is to just make the whole log line
back into a single string, and this gets masked correctly.

Change-Id: I0fdd895c9449d9a90d811af4ded34f32ba2b2215
'}]
commit_message:
Mask password when specified as an argument with a space

I was using a command line like

 $ openstack user password set --password "p" --original-password="x"

and saw the --password argument echoed in the info log

 START with options: ['-v', ..., 'user', 'password', 'set', '--password', 'p', '--original-password=***']

The masking works if you set "--password=p", but not "--password p".
This is because the password matching regex doesn't know they're
related.  An easy way to avoid this is to just make the whole log line
back into a single string, and this gets masked correctly.

Change-Id: I0fdd895c9449d9a90d811af4ded34f32ba2b2215

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-03 01:40:00.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I19e4deb3c709e0918aa4888bdf7962aab43cc632
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I19e4deb3c709e0918aa4888bdf7962aab43cc632
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Edit document for cinder guide

This comment is to remind those who use Kolla to deploy Cinder
of bug #1631072 (https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla/+bug/1631072),
in which the folder /sys/kernel/config is either empty
or not created in several operating systems.

Related-Bug: #1631072
Change-Id: Ieef9a8292dbac32e8c11aa2916fce3a133732160

'}, {'created': '2018-09-07 07:41:12.000000000', 'message': "zuul: Add openSUSE Leap 15 jobs

We make the following changes in order to support openSUSE Leap 15.0

- Updates the bindep.txt file to match the SUSE family.
- The netstat binary has been moved to net-tools-deprecated
  package.
- We fix a bug when checking the status to extra dependencies. The
  variable is an array, but the code was only checking the first
  entry of the array.
- Replace spaces with '_' on ansible_distribution since openSUSE Leap
  15.0 is being reported as 'openSUSE Leap' by ansible.

Change-Id: I800331e29e0d47a3121229cd66a5814277e34b84

commit_message:
Add openSUSE Leap 15 jobs

We make the following changes in order to support openSUSE Leap 15.0

- Updates the bindep.txt file to match the SUSE family.
- The netstat binary has been moved to net-tools-deprecated
  package.
- We fix a bug when checking the status to extra dependencies. The
  variable is an array, but the code was only checking the first
  entry of the array.
- Replace spaces with '_' on ansible_distribution since openSUSE Leap
  15.0 is being reported as 'openSUSE Leap' by Ansible.

Change-Id: I800331e29e0d47a3121229cd66a5814277e34b84

'}, {'created': '2018-10-26 15:05:29.000000000', 'message': "Improve deep_compare detection

In the initial implementation of resource updates in puppet-pacemaker,
in order to detect if a resource changed we did the following:
1) dump the cib and make a copy
2) remove the resource from the dump
3) readd the resource with current parameters
4) via crm_diff --cib we would detect if there were any changes related
   to the resource by checking a specific xpath on the the diff
5) If 4) matched the xpath we would push the newly created CIB back to
   the cluster

This approach has a number of drawbacks:
A) In case of bundles it would remove the resource running inside the
bundle for a very brief amount of time
B) pcs would remove all constraints related to the resource
automatically, so we had to recreate them forcefully during the update
operation and then update the CIB
C) We sometimes missed to trigger a resource update because the XPATH on
4) was not always matching and so we missed updating a resource from
time to time.

We now change approach slightly to make it more robust. Namely,
instead of removing a resource from the offline CIB we actually just
update it via pcs update commands on the offline CIB. In the case of
bundles we need to actually remove all currently existing storage maps
and then add the newly defined set, because pcs does not allow to update
a resource in a declarative way [1]. We also extend the xpath at C) to match
most things and also be careful about not matching empty meta attributes
which get added by pcs due to a bug [2].
This new approach solves A) and B) and is also more precise and solve C)
fully as well.

Given the complexity of the changes here is how I tested this change:
1) 1 mount point added
Oct 25 14:46:31 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource rabbitmq-bundle
and rabbitmq-bundle was correctly restarted with the correct bind mounts

2) 1 mount point removed
Oct 25 15:56:38 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource rabbitmq-bundle
and rabbitmq-bundle was correctly restarted with the correct bind mounts

3) 3 mount points added
Oct 26 01:46:42 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource rabbitmq-bundle
and rabbitmq-bundle was correctly restarted with the correct bind mounts

4) 2 mount points removed
Oct 26 02:42:07 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource rabbitmq-bundle
and rabbitmq-bundle was correctly restarted with the correct bind mounts

5) 1 mount point added plus replicas number changed
Correctly get a reduced replicas number and correct mount point
 Docker container set: rabbitmq-bundle [192.168.24.1:8787/rhosp13/openstack-rabbitmq:pcmklatest]
   rabbitmq-bundle-0    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started controller-2
   rabbitmq-bundle-1    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started controller-0

6) VIP netmask changed (from /32 to /24)
Oct 26 03:53:04 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource ip-192.168.24.10
Oct 26 03:53:20 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource ip-10.0.0.101
Oct 26 03:53:36 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource ip-172.17.1.12
Oct 26 03:53:52 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource ip-172.17.1.10
Oct 26 03:54:07 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource ip-172.17.3.17
Oct 26 03:54:24 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource ip-172.17.4.13
[root@controller-0 10]# ip -o a |grep '/32'
[root@controller-0 10]#

7) VIP netmask changed (from /24 to /32) and bundle replicas number changed
rabbitmq-bundle went from two replicas (see 5.) to three:
 Docker container set: rabbitmq-bundle [192.168.24.1:8787/rhosp13/openstack-rabbitmq:pcmklatest]
   rabbitmq-bundle-0    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started controller-2
   rabbitmq-bundle-1    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started controller-0
   rabbitmq-bundle-2    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started controller-1

VIP netmasks correctly moved from /24 to /32

8) Redeploy with no changes
No resources were restarted

9) Change mount point order in puppet does not restart the service
Oct 26 04:59:36 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned false for resource rabbitmq-bundle

10) Change a single option of a mountpoint
Oct 26 05:32:13 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource rabbitmq-bundle
and rabbitmq-bundle was correctly restarted with the correct bind mounts

11) Change a parameter of a pacemaker remote resource
Added the following hiera keys:
  pacemaker::resource::remote::deep_compare: true
  pacemaker_remote_reconnect_interval: 105

and correctly got:
[root@controller-0 ~]# pcs resource show compute-0 |grep reconnect
  Attributes: reconnect_interval=105 server=172.17.1.14

12) Change 1 mount point on three bundles
Oct 26 10:40:30 controller-0 dockerd-current[19339]: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource rabbitmq-bundle

13) Try and change a meta attribute
Added an 'ordered=true' to the rabbitmq bundle
[root@controller-0 ~]# pcs resource show rabbitmq-bundle |grep ordered
   Meta Attrs: container-attribute-target=host notify=true ordered=true

14) Delete a single location constraint and redeploy
[root@controller-0 ~]# pcs constraint remove location-rabbitmq-bundle
..redeployed..
[root@controller-0 ~]# pcs constraint |grep rabbit
  Resource: rabbitmq-bundle
    Constraint: location-rabbitmq-bundle (resource-discovery=exclusive)
        Expression: rabbitmq-role eq true

Other things verified during the tests above:
- Constraints stayed the same
- Properties stayed the same

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1598197
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1568353
Closes-Bug: #1797542

Change-Id: I048fbb6b0319bac33c82ad2d7639d0f594fb73bb

commit_message:
Improve deep_compare detection

In the initial implementation of resource updates in puppet-pacemaker,
in order to detect if a resource changed we did the following:
1) dump the cib and make a copy
2) remove the resource from the dump
3) readd the resource with current parameters
4) via crm_diff --cib we would detect if there were any changes related
   to the resource by checking a specific xpath on the the diff
5) If 4) matched the xpath we would push the newly created CIB back to
   the cluster

This approach has a number of drawbacks:
A) In case of bundles it would remove the resource running inside the
bundle for a very brief amount of time
B) pcs would remove all constraints related to the resource
automatically, so we had to recreate them forcefully during the update
operation and then update the CIB
C) We sometimes missed to trigger a resource update because the XPATH on
4) was not always matching and so we missed updating a resource from
time to time.

We now change approach slightly to make it more robust. Namely,
instead of removing a resource from the offline CIB we actually just
update it via pcs update commands on the offline CIB. In the case of
bundles we need to actually remove all currently existing storage maps
and then add the newly defined set, because pcs does not allow to update
a resource in a declarative way [1]. We also extend the xpath at C) to match
most things and also be careful about not matching empty meta attributes
which get added by pcs due to a bug [2].
This new approach solves A) and B) and is also more precise and solve C)
fully as well.

Given the complexity of the changes here is how I tested this change:
1) 1 mount point added
Oct 25 14:46:31 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource rabbitmq-bundle
and rabbitmq-bundle was correctly restarted with the correct bind mounts

2) 1 mount point removed
Oct 25 15:56:38 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource rabbitmq-bundle
and rabbitmq-bundle was correctly restarted with the correct bind mounts

3) 3 mount points added
Oct 26 01:46:42 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource rabbitmq-bundle
and rabbitmq-bundle was correctly restarted with the correct bind mounts

4) 2 mount points removed
Oct 26 02:42:07 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource rabbitmq-bundle
and rabbitmq-bundle was correctly restarted with the correct bind mounts

5) 1 mount point added plus replicas number changed
Correctly get a reduced replicas number and correct mount point
 Docker container set: rabbitmq-bundle [192.168.24.1:8787/rhosp13/openstack-rabbitmq:pcmklatest]
   rabbitmq-bundle-0    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started controller-2
   rabbitmq-bundle-1    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started controller-0

6) VIP netmask changed (from /32 to /24)
Oct 26 03:53:04 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource ip-192.168.24.10
Oct 26 03:53:20 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource ip-10.0.0.101
Oct 26 03:53:36 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource ip-172.17.1.12
Oct 26 03:53:52 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource ip-172.17.1.10
Oct 26 03:54:07 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource ip-172.17.3.17
Oct 26 03:54:24 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource ip-172.17.4.13
[root@controller-0 10]# ip -o a |grep '/32'
[root@controller-0 10]#

7) VIP netmask changed (from /24 to /32) and bundle replicas number changed
rabbitmq-bundle went from two replicas (see 5.) to three:
 Docker container set: rabbitmq-bundle [192.168.24.1:8787/rhosp13/openstack-rabbitmq:pcmklatest]
   rabbitmq-bundle-0    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started controller-2
   rabbitmq-bundle-1    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started controller-0
   rabbitmq-bundle-2    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started controller-1

VIP netmasks correctly moved from /24 to /32

8) Redeploy with no changes
No resources were restarted

9) Change mount point order in puppet does not restart the service
Oct 26 04:59:36 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned false for resource rabbitmq-bundle

10) Change a single option of a mountpoint
Oct 26 05:32:13 controller-0 journal: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource rabbitmq-bundle
and rabbitmq-bundle was correctly restarted with the correct bind mounts

11) Change a parameter of a pacemaker remote resource
Added the following hiera keys:
  pacemaker::resource::remote::deep_compare: true
  pacemaker_remote_reconnect_interval: 105

and correctly got:
[root@controller-0 ~]# pcs resource show compute-0 |grep reconnect
  Attributes: reconnect_interval=105 server=172.17.1.14

12) Change 1 mount point on three bundles
Oct 26 10:40:30 controller-0 dockerd-current[19339]: Debug: pcmk_resource_has_changed (ng version) returned true for resource rabbitmq-bundle

13) Try and change a meta attribute
Added an 'ordered=true' to the rabbitmq bundle
[root@controller-0 ~]# pcs resource show rabbitmq-bundle |grep ordered
   Meta Attrs: container-attribute-target=host notify=true ordered=true

14) Delete a single location constraint and redeploy
[root@controller-0 ~]# pcs constraint remove location-rabbitmq-bundle
..redeployed..
[root@controller-0 ~]# pcs constraint |grep rabbit
  Resource: rabbitmq-bundle
    Constraint: location-rabbitmq-bundle (resource-discovery=exclusive)
        Expression: rabbitmq-role eq true

Other things verified during the tests above:
- Constraints stayed the same
- Properties stayed the same

In some cases, we might not be signaling properly to

Change-Id: I0265d4bf53d6486ca0650ec440e48a4863028177
'}]
commit_message:
Set default_boot_option for bifrost

Bifrost is opinionated in that machines should
be able to always boot without ironic being present.

In some cases, we might not be signaling properly to
the machines to boot locally, and as such they may be
network booting.

Change-Id: I0265d4bf53d6486ca0650ec440e48a4863028177

I don't think we need to. We tolerate the hctl being missing because not all disks are scsi based disks. The vendor, I don't think that is an issue either, it just prevents that being explicitly matched.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2018-08-31 20:28:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

My last comment wasn't very clear: I didn't mean to suggest that holder or slave devices should be removed from the list. What I meant was to remove multiple identical entries for the same device (which we will have with md devices in the output of 'lsblk'). For a raid1 device called md0 composed of sda and sdb, the list would currently be

md0
sda
md0
sdb

as the holder md device would be listed for each slave in the output of 'lsblk'. My proposal is hence simply to reduce that list to

md0
sda
sdb

in order to not query md0 multiple times down the line."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-09-07 15:11:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-16 18:17:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fix mutli-device behavior

ATARAID is functionally a version of software
RAID where the setup is managed by the controller
and the Operating System takes over managing the
RAID after boot. Most commonly this is found for
mirrored boot devices.

Prior to this patch, we were looking for non-dependent
items (i.e. base block devices), with a type of disk.

Now we will permit the "disk" to be added to the list
if lsblk indicates that it is a type containing "raid".
The lsblk results should not change as we explicitly
look for disk objects.

Change-Id: Ia4a03b33cc06ce42e1bc33026683c28b31901cb7
Story: #2003445
Task: #24647

commit_message:
Fix multi-device behavior

ATARAID is functionally a version of software
RAID where the setup is managed by the controller
and the Operating System takes over managing the
RAID after boot. Most commonly this is found for
mirrored boot devices.

Prior to this patch, we were looking for non-dependent
items (i.e. base block devices), with a type of disk.

Now we will permit the "disk" to be added to the list
if lsblk indicates that it is a type containing "raid".
The lsblk results should not change as we explicitly
look for disk objects.

Change-Id: Ia4a03b33cc06ce42e1bc33026683c28b31901cb7
Story: #2003445
Task: #24647

messages: [{'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2018-10-29 15:36:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-10-31 15:11:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-11-12 12:41:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-29 15:36:02.000000000', 'message': "Don't set recurse on config folders

A small number of services set the recurse flag when they create
their config directory. This can change permission of files within
the directory, which are later set back to the original state. The
side effect is that the service is then restarted, even though the
net change to the config files amounts to nothing. The expected
behaviour is that a service only restarts if the config *has*
changed. This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: Ib6f1ca7b416247f8d455fb25892f4a3b27de03ba
Closes-Bug: 1800480
"}]
commit_message:
Don't set recurse on config folders

A small number of services set the recurse flag when they create
their config directory. This can change permission of files within
the directory, which are later set back to the original state. The
side effect is that the service is then restarted, even though the
net change to the config files amounts to nothing. The expected
behaviour is that a service only restarts if the config *has*
changed. This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: Ib6f1ca7b416247f8d455fb25892f4a3b27de03ba
Closes-Bug: 1800480

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.
Update to reflect reality, which should help with local running of
constraints targets.

Change-Id: I426cebf26d4c386355fb0052ed12bda39d67fc49

The layered product

Change-Id: Ibd64ac1407333c1548261f9d2ae69cdf013e94ce
'}, {'created': '2018-09-25 19:55:50.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Handle LP openvswitch meta-package on upgrade

The layered product

Closes-Bug: #1794359

Change-Id: Ibd64ac1407333c1548261f9d2ae69cdf013e94ce
'}, {'created': '2018-09-26 13:21:56.000000000', 'message': 'Handle LP openvswitch meta-package on upgrade

A layered product package may be used in systems upgrading from
openvswitch 2.9 to 2.10 and involves a package name change for
openvswitch. This patch adds special handling for this kind of upgrade
to handle the layered product package as well as avoiding shutting down
the existing openvswitch install to preserve the data plane as well as
prevent disruption of the control plane in the event it is using an
openvswitch controlled interface.

Closes-Bug: #1794359

Change-Id: Ibd64ac1407333c1548261f9d2ae69cdf013e94ce
'}, {'created': '2018-09-27 13:55:36.000000000', 'message': 'Handle LP openvswitch meta-package on upgrade

'}, {'created': '2018-10-15 18:49:39.000000000', 'message': 'Handle LP openvswitch meta-package on upgrade

A layered product package may be used in systems upgrading from
openvswitch 2.9 to 2.10 and involves a package name change for
openvswitch. This patch adds special handling for this kind of upgrade
to handle the layered product package as well as avoiding shutting down
the existing openvswitch install to preserve the data plane as well as
prevent disruption of the control plane in the event it is using an
openvswitch controlled interface.

Note that this patch also moves the special upgrade logic to
tripleo-packages because it could affect any node that is running
openvswitch for host networking, not just those that are using it for
cloud workloads.

Closes-Bug: #1794359

Change-Id: Ibd64ac1407333c1548261f9d2ae69cdf013e94ce
'}, {'created': '2018-10-16 10:15:55.000000000', 'message': 'Handle LP openvswitch meta-package on upgrade

Closes-Bug: #1794359

Change-Id: Ibd64ac1407333c1548261f9d2ae69cdf013e94ce
'}, {'created': '2018-10-26 19:44:51.000000000', 'message': 'Handle LP openvswitch meta-package on upgrade

With layered product packaging upgrading openvswitch may involve a
package rename of the openvswitch package (e.g. openvswitch to
openvswitch 2.10 or openvswitch2.12 to openvswitch2.13) This patch
adds special handling for the rhosp-openvswitch layered product package
to ensure that openvswitch networking remains available during the
upgrade.

Note that this patch also moves the special upgrade logic to
tripleo-packages because it could affect any node that is running
openvswitch for host networking, not just those that are using it for
cloud workloads.

Closes-Bug: #1794359

Change-Id: Ibd64ac1407333c1548261f9d2ae69cdf013e94ce

Closes-Bug: #1794359

Change-Id: Ibd64ac1407333c1548261f9d2ae69cdf013e94ce
'}, {'created': '2018-11-08 18:24:36.000000000', 'message': 'Handle LP openvswitch meta-package on upgrade

With layered product packaging upgrading openvswitch may involve a
package rename of the openvswitch package (e.g. openvswitch to
openvswitch 2.10 or openvswitch2.12 to openvswitch2.13) This patch
adds special handling for the rhosp-openvswitch layered product package
to ensure that openvswitch networking remains available during the
upgrade.

Note that this patch also moves the special upgrade logic to
tripleo-packages because it could affect any node that is running
openvswitch for host networking, not just those that are using it for
cloud workloads.

Closes-Bug: #1794359

Change-Id: Ibd64ac1407333c1548261f9d2ae69cdf013e94ce
'}]
commit_message:
Handle LP openvswitch meta-package on upgrade

With layered product packaging upgrading openvswitch may involve a
package rename of the openvswitch package (e.g. openvswitch to
openvswitch 2.10 or openvswitch2.12 to openvswitch2.13) This patch
adds special handling for the rhosp-openvswitch layered product package
to ensure that openvswitch networking remains available during the
upgrade.

Note that this patch also moves the special upgrade logic to
tripleo-packages because it could affect any node that is running
openvswitch for host networking, not just those that are using it for
cloud workloads.

Closes-Bug: #1794359

Change-Id: Ibd64ac1407333c1548261f9d2ae69cdf013e94ce

commit_message:
Retire dragonflow

Dragonflow has requested a removal from governance, and this was
merged [1]. It is not in the same order as the usual procedure
[2].

I still think we should follow the procedure where we can, and
apply step 2 by removing project gating.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613856/3
[2]: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/617279/
Change-Id: I23555706ba5ac5d6056566dadca9b9371274a152

[{'account_id': 29488, 'date': '2018-11-12 12:47:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-11-12 12:47:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 29488, 'date': '2018-11-12 12:53:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29488, 'date': '2018-11-12 12:54:58.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This was a test, a mistake actually!'}]

Fixed permission for DLRN dir

[{'created': '2018-11-08 18:42:19.000000000', 'message': 'UT: Fix unit tests failures

After 3316b45665a99b0f61e45a8c7facf538618861bf got merged in
Neutron, our gate is blocked due to unit tests failing.
After some debugging, it looks like no longer importing
neutron.db.api is the culprit. This patch is importing it
from our unit tests to unbreak the gate while the actual
root case is determined.

Change-Id: Ib1aab6370afa903002af540e17fee17940756c83
Partial-Bug: #1802369
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
UT: Fix unit tests failures

After 3316b45665a99b0f61e45a8c7facf538618861bf got merged in
Neutron, our gate is blocked due to unit tests failing.
After some debugging, it looks like no longer importing
neutron.db.api is the culprit. This patch is importing it
from our unit tests to unbreak the gate while the actual
root case is determined.

Change-Id: Ib1aab6370afa903002af540e17fee17940756c83
Partial-Bug: #1802369
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update bindep-fallback for openSUSE 15.0

openSUSE 15.0 does not have libffi48-devel, instead we can use
libffi-devel. Install libffi48-devel only on openSUSE 42.3.

This was triggered by the failure in https://review.openstack.org/617282

Change-Id: I2207d69bd837a7249476b4a20025f41df3a7bc84

I think a reno is necessary like this change. And, I'm actually unsure that why we should force tempest users to use python 3 by default. And what things will be better with this change?"}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2018-07-03 18:39:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

There is a lot of this kind of patches for most projects but these patches are marked as WIP without clear reason like https://review.openstack.org/#/q/owner:%22Alessandro+Nesta%22+status:open

I guess that is because we will do that in Stein as 
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-June/131672.html
but I am not sure at this time.
Anyways this patch also needs to be marked as WIP like the other patches.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-03 18:44:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(9 comments)

I don't think it's a good idea to use python3 for Tempest API/scenario/plugin tests because in Zuul we still use py27 for validation.

I think it's OK to use py3 for things like reno or pep8 because of the OpenStack future goal of using py3. But agree with tagging as WIP as stated above."}, {'account_id': 17499, 'date': '2018-08-24 08:54:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 28935, 'date': '2018-08-28 06:45:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 28614, 'date': '2018-10-04 06:50:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 15:46:22.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I938b5b4eb07a1028b4c3fd56f9fb36f1670b8230
'}, {'created': '2018-06-10 15:45:40.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I938b5b4eb07a1028b4c3fd56f9fb36f1670b8230
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I938b5b4eb07a1028b4c3fd56f9fb36f1670b8230

commit_message:
vault-kv: Add functional test

Add ceph-mon and ceph-osd charms to smoke testing bundle
to ensure coverage of vault-kv relation and associated
secrets storage functionality.

Change-Id: Ibe6e0206cb336ff384a8da48bcdadde0ce8f11b8

commit_message:
Use default Value of 'is_public' when update and its none

When update a volume type whoes 'is_public' is false. If don't
input is_public in request, its value will become True.
So, I think the default value should be used.

Change-Id: I2611c62af2eb086fed05708de877e16084304bd4

commit_message:
CAA DNS records

This patchset adds support for DNS CAA (Certification Authority
Authorization) Resource Record which is described in RFC 6844
(https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6844)

Change-Id: If9619096f1706d1123895b63b9129b9ffd4fb320
Closes-Bug: 1787552

NAPTR DNS records

This patchset adds support for DNS NAPTR (Naming Authority
Pointer) Resource Record which is described in RFC 2915
(https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2915)

Change-Id: Ic7d26a6c653ce46e67438e983476782edd6ec890
Closes-Bug: 1779850

commit_message:
Switch to openSUSE 15.0 testing

Change from openSUSE 42.3 to 15.0 for testing
(Yes, 15.0 is current version and 42.3 is older).

Note that we need to keep on old job to be able to rename the job in
shade repository.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/617276
Change-Id: I8e39e4ba930b3586193cfe44c5e0dc167b5afb90

messages:
[{'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2018-09-17 18:53:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-09-17 18:53:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2018-09-17 21:07:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-09-17 21:53:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- tripleo-ci-centos-7-undercloud-containers: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1708704

If you believe we've correctly identified the failure, feel free to leave a 'recheck' comment to run the tests again.
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/"}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-09-18 04:43:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-10-09 08:56:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-10-09 09:24:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Generally good. But I'd like to improve the implementation a little bit."}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2018-10-09 12:10:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Fixing Renat's comments will be beneficial."}, {'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2018-10-10 08:48:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > Generally good. But I'd like to improve the implementation a little
 > bit.

This check is simple performance optimization, which omit double convertation to and from yaml if wf count is 1. If we want to merge cases "== 1" and "> 1", we could do this one of this ways:
a) Move convertation to yaml into cut_wf and check length there. In this case, we will convert big wf to yaml for every wf in it.
b) Don't move convertation, pass wfs count into cut_wf. In this case, even if we have 1 wf, we have it converted to yaml, and we should convert it back anyway. 

If the value of such optimization is exaggerated by me and readability is more important here, let me know :)'}, {'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2018-10-10 09:44:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2018-10-11 07:20:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Can we improve it a little bit by simplifying the function? I may have overlooked something but it very much seems to me like this should work. At the same time I have a slight concern that the original yaml may contain additional info that is lost in this translation. Though, this may be an overthought.'}, {'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2018-10-11 08:25:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > Can we improve it a little bit by simplifying the function? I may
 > have overlooked something but it very much seems to me like this
 > should work. At the same time I have a slight concern that the
 > original yaml may contain additional info that is lost in this
 > translation. Though, this may be an overthought.

I agree with you, we could lose something, but there is no point in the docs, which says that we should support comments and so on :) However, I think that we got the balance between readability and performance, so any changes there will lead to loss of one of them.'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2018-10-11 09:05:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

Let's see some numbers, shall we? I like the fact that you really take performance into consideration. Though, I feel like this is not the place to be afraid of."}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-10-11 09:15:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-10-11 09:17:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2018-10-11 10:34:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

(1 comment)

I remove my vote and don't support this either. In fact, I do nothing in this case, I guess. Haha."}, {'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2018-10-11 11:26:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2018-10-11 11:29:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2018-10-11 11:43:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > I remove my vote and don't support this either. In fact, I do
 > nothing in this case, I guess. Haha.

OK, I agree with you, it is not a big deal. I removed this check. Moreover, the real optimization was in the first patch, when this check was on the upper level. 
Now, conversion will be done all the time. This approach guarantees the same output format, without any comments :)
We should keep in mind timeout and everything will be OK"}, {'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2018-10-25 15:21:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2018-11-06 07:35:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2018-11-09 07:27:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2018-11-12 05:19:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

Having an option to turn off saving the spec in this form may be a valid option for huge definitions.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-11-12 09:02:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Divide yaml input to save it into definitions separately.

In case of creating/updating multiple workflows from one yaml,
we should not save the whole input to each workflow.

Closes-Bug: #1792975
Change-Id: I724c041ab3441805fcfa2cfc4a50afd774998cc7
Signed-off-by: Oleg Ovcharuk <vgvoleg@gmail.com>

In order to create the Fedora docker image, use the following command:
docker build -t dragonflow -f Dockerfile.fedora .

Recently we have added features that are supported only with Python 3,
so this docker will allow us to run them natively.
e.g. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/616106

commit_message:
Add Fedora based docker file creation

This docker image is using Python 3.6 as default instead of the 2.6
version used by the default image.
In order to create the Fedora docker image, use the following command:
docker build -t dragonflow -f Dockerfile.fedora .

Recently we have added features that are supported only with Python 3,
so this docker will allow us to run them natively.
e.g. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/616106

Co-Authored-By: Omer Anson <omer.anson@toganetworks.com>
Change-Id: Iefd88738424906e832564b23f69320b775c98376
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-dragonflow-api

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-09 04:02:25.000000000', 'message': 'nodepool: Add arm64ci cloud

Credentials are populated (Ib96d14008ab3b8b7c12429d7432eaa485c404bb2),
mirror.nrt1.arm64ci.openstack.org is alive so everything is ready to
go.

We have a quota of 40 cores & 96gb ram; the c1.large flavor is 8/core
8gb.  Should we should be able to fit 5 CI servers to start with.

Change-Id: I428d46565921e018ac01cbd9c64b4be60c44f3d5
'}]
commit_message:
nodepool: Add arm64ci cloud

Credentials are populated (Ib96d14008ab3b8b7c12429d7432eaa485c404bb2),
mirror.nrt1.arm64ci.openstack.org is alive so everything is ready to
go.

We have a quota of 40 cores & 96gb ram; the c1.large flavor is 8/core
8gb.  Should we should be able to fit 5 CI servers to start with.

Change-Id: I428d46565921e018ac01cbd9c64b4be60c44f3d5

subject: Properly calculate auth_url for WEBSSO from POST data
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-12 09:07:29.000000000', 'message': "Properly calculate auth_url for WEBSSO from POST data

The redirect for WEBSSO takes its data directly from the request's
POST data, and the format of that data has changed, so now we need
to convert it for it to work correctly.

Change-Id: I5b18e555a9bc6b24be1e59465f07e73e99739e22
closes-bug: #1794710
(cherry picked from commit 1953c689e86ecdf131b4cf176bf4ff47b53493cf)
"}]
commit_message:
Properly calculate auth_url for WEBSSO from POST data

The redirect for WEBSSO takes its data directly from the request's
POST data, and the format of that data has changed, so now we need
to convert it for it to work correctly.

Change-Id: I5b18e555a9bc6b24be1e59465f07e73e99739e22
closes-bug: #1794710
(cherry picked from commit 1953c689e86ecdf131b4cf176bf4ff47b53493cf)

commit_message:
Make ODL healthcheck IPv6 compatible

Add missing brackets around IPv6 address
in healthcheck curl URL for ODL.

Change-Id: I165a3a44fad12c36160d201541971cf0a395b38c
Closes-Bug: #1789350
(cherry picked from commit 2ed70a654b6cd91256da49806cdbb2b4918fb1a3)

[{'created': '2018-08-09 17:58:22.000000000', 'message': "Fix nfvo_plugin may add double /v3 postfix to auth_url

When getting auth_url from CONF, nfvo_plugin appends the '/v3'
postfix without checking whether the auth_url already has it or not.

tacker/nfvo/nfvo_plugin.py

...
    def get_auth_dict(self, context):
        auth = CONF.keystone_authtoken
        return {
            'auth_url': auth.auth_url + '/v3',
            'token': context.auth_token,
            'project_domain_name': auth.project_domain_name or context.domain,
            'project_name': context.tenant_name
        }
...

Change-Id: I30abaff188bd1d352750cb327a624c1e8ced884f

        return {
            'auth_url': auth.auth_url + '/v3',

"}, {'created': '2018-08-11 17:43:55.000000000', 'message': "Remove the need to append '/v3' suffix to auth_url in several places

Implementing a utility function to check auth_url which is defined in
the keystone_authtoken section of /etc/tacker/tacker.conf. So that,
there is no need to append the '/v3' suffix in several places such as
nfvo_plugin and alarm_reciever. In the other hand, this requires the
auth_url option has to be set correctly in /etc/tacker/tacker.conf.
The correct form of auth_url is:

http://<keystone url>:<keystone port>/v3
or
http://<keystone url>:<keystone port>/identify/v3

Changes:
- Create a validate_keystone_auth_url function in tacker.common.utils
- Check auth_url in get_auth_dict in nfvo_plugin
- Check auth_url in alarm_receiver
- Update the test

Change-Id: I30abaff188bd1d352750cb327a624c1e8ced884f

commit_message:
Correct '/v3' suffix to auth_url

Implementing a utility function to check auth_url which is defined in
the keystone_authtoken section of /etc/tacker/tacker.conf. So that,
'/v3' suffix will be added (if it is missed) to match with keystoneclient
v3.

Changes:
- Create a validate_keystone_auth_url function in tacker.nfvo.nfvo_plugin
- Check auth_url in get_auth_dict in nfvo_plugin

Co-Authored-By: Cong Phuoc Hoang <hoangphuocbk2.07@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I30abaff188bd1d352750cb327a624c1e8ced884f

commit_message:
Correctly handle complex nameserver types for standalone

If the undercloud_undercloud_nameserver is an array, it's not being
properly represented in the output yaml. Let's use the ansible to_json
filter to properly handle this in the resulting yaml.

Change-Id: Ia16060e2c2e524d0a4c83980b2fd9fafef09196f
Closes-Bug: #1802611

commit_message:
Allow simple REST API container deployment

* Add verbs to container entrypoint

* Have REST API serve the schema JSON

* Add documentation explaining how to deploy

Co-Authored-By: Shachar Snapiri <shachar.snapiri@toganetworks.com>
Change-Id: I243130a219d3e9e96bf87d39693e600ea4b627a2
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-dragonflow-api

commit_message:
WIP - SRIOV live migration

This commit is at POC level for enabling SRIOV live migration
over macVtap.
It is intended for initial discussion.
final commit will be split and cleaned from hooks and un-neccessary
debug prints.

Change-Id: I3230fe67270f8b14302805da2ba82309828b8622

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:49:48.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If1575ac4d8250bec1f445de7cb0ebcb398bd4e8d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If1575ac4d8250bec1f445de7cb0ebcb398bd4e8d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Fix the keystone tokenflush validation
messages: [{'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2018-11-05 11:27:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17888, 'date': '2018-11-08 11:43:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9317, 'date': '2018-11-09 11:08:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 17888, 'date': '2018-11-12 08:34:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit 2c9d26d737e72998205ec3862f977c4a71248349'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-05 11:27:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix the keystone tokenflush validation

After containerization of the keystone service the `crontab` call that is
made to determine if the 'keystone-manage token_flush' command is present in
the keystone crontab doesn't work anymore (since it's executed outside of the
container where the service is running).

This patch looks up the container id with the `docker ps` command and executes
`crontab` inside of the container.

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I9adaad58a4d53fb3d8f379ffcd3261f1c70e5adb
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the keystone tokenflush validation

After containerization of the keystone service the `crontab` call that is
made to determine if the 'keystone-manage token_flush' command is present in
the keystone crontab doesn't work anymore (since it's executed outside of the
container where the service is running).

This patch looks up the container id with the `docker ps` command and executes
`crontab` inside of the container.

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I9adaad58a4d53fb3d8f379ffcd3261f1c70e5adb

commit_message:
Properly calculate auth_url for WEBSSO from POST data

The redirect for WEBSSO takes its data directly from the request's
POST data, and the format of that data has changed, so now we need
to convert it for it to work correctly.

Change-Id: I5b18e555a9bc6b24be1e59465f07e73e99739e22
closes-bug: #1794710

[{'created': '2018-10-09 21:30:26.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args

Change-Id: Ie24ac998d108b33c35f21d0fa6efde02cffe120e
"}, {'created': '2018-11-06 02:00:56.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: Ie24ac998d108b33c35f21d0fa6efde02cffe120e
Closes-Bug:#1801827

commit_message:
Switch stable scenarios to voting

In master we have removed these from the gate as they are non-voting
because we plan on replacing them with standalone versions. However for
stable branches we will want to leave these as voting since they are
defined in the gate in the branch layout.

Change-Id: I7a859ac1db9206301df897553320fca70ea33980
Related-Bug: #1802144

Very nice.  I just wonder how we can test/generate that stuff without too much hassle, do you have a way ?'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-10-25 10:57:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Very nice.  I just wonder how we can test/generate that stuff
 > without too much hassle, do you have a way ?

Sure! I did with this file as parameters file for role:
[jfrancoa@localhost repos]$ cat workarounds
upgrade_workarounds: True
pre_undercloud_upgrade_workarounds:
    - rhbz1:
        patch: true
        basedir: /home/stack/
        id: 112233
        command:
    - rhbz2:
        patch: true
        basedir: /home/stack/
        id: 112234
        command:
    - rhbz3:
        patch: false
        basedir:
        id:
        command: 'some command goes here'
post_undercloud_upgrade_workarounds:
    - rhbz10:
        patch: true
        basedir: /usr/share/
        id: 223344
        command: ''

And this simple playbook that will generate the scripts only for the undercloud: 

[jfrancoa@localhost repos]$ cat oooq-test.yaml
---
- hosts: localhost
  gather_facts: true
  tasks:
    - name: Run workaround script create
      include_role:
        name: tripleo-upgrade
        tasks_from: upgrade/create-undercloud-upgrade-scripts.yaml  

You can run it with: ansible-playbook -v oooq-test.yaml -e @workarounds
in the same directory where you have your tripleo-upgrade role."}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2018-10-25 19:21:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-11-08 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 21537, 'date': '2018-11-09 07:37:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 21537, 'date': '2018-11-12 06:54:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit 88d237c47b185ab3fc541fffd7c5cde3872c2b86'}]

commit_message:
Use Jinja2 macro to remove redundancy in workarounds.sh.j2.

Currenty, a lot of code was being repeted in the template which
would force to modify it in multiple places if a change was being
done in one of the workaround blocks. By using the Jinja2 macro,
which behaves as a function, we can reuse the code defining it in
one single place and calling to it multiple times.

Change-Id: I63db9e8b30c9f9e99c501300982b513b627bed07

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-29 03:54:32.000000000', 'message': 'Checksum/hash in metadata when replacing locations

Allow embedding of values for checksum, os_hash_algo and
os_hash_value in the "metadata" for the new location(s) if
(and only if) the image is in "queued" state, and those attributes
do not already have values. Values may be included with one or
more of the "locations", but must not have different values. These
items will be removed (popped) from the metadata and stored only in
the appropriate image properties.

spec-lite dependency to be added when specs repo ready for stein

Change-Id: I1308fb1dec21002a9777bd0c77e9c02e59527551

more of the "locations", but must not have different values. These
items will be removed (popped) from the metadata and stored only in
the appropriate image properties.

Change-Id: I1308fb1dec21002a9777bd0c77e9c02e59527551
'}, {'created': '2018-09-04 22:58:59.000000000', 'message': 'Checksum/hash in metadata when setting locations

Allow embedding of new values for checksum, os_hash_algo and os_hash_value in
metadata when adding to or replacing the locations for an image, if (and only
if) the image is in "queued" status. Values may be included with one or more of
the "locations", but must not have different values. These items will be
removed (popped) from the metadata and stored only in the appropriate image
properties.

commit_message:
Embed validation data in locations

Allow embedding of checksum, os_hash_algo and os_hash_value in a
special writeOnly json-patch object when updating locations for an image.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/597648
Change-Id: I1308fb1dec21002a9777bd0c77e9c02e59527551

commit_message:
Switch stable scenarios to voting

In master we have removed these from the gate as they are non-voting
because we plan on replacing them with standalone versions. However for
stable branches we will want to leave these as voting since they are
defined in the gate in the branch layout.

Change-Id: I7a859ac1db9206301df897553320fca70ea33980
Related-Bug: #1802144
(cherry picked from commit 3061e5d1bce513b3d58eae963722569b7f9bb50b)

commit_message:
Switch stable scenarios to voting

In master we have removed these from the gate as they are non-voting
because we plan on replacing them with standalone versions. However for
stable branches we will want to leave these as voting since they are
defined in the gate in the branch layout.

Change-Id: I80f1530dc11131eb855523551f84b798c25628b5
Related-Bug: #1802144
(cherry picked from commit 0f5e96c7ce285372cfe6d535c6ea679c4e105be7)

subject: Fix listing checkpoints by plan error with FS bank
messages: [{'account_id': 21224, 'date': '2018-11-12 04:49:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21224, 'date': '2018-11-12 05:55:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-12 04:49:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix listing checkpoints by plan error with FS bank

When listing checkpoints by plan with using FS bank,
it will fail with 'could not be found' error. The reason
is, in the bank, checkpoints by plan are stored as
"<bank_path>/karbor/indices/by-plan/<plan_id>/<project_id>
/<date>/<checkpoint>", but the file bank plugin only list
the <date> level, not include the checkpoint level. This
patch will fix it.

Closes-Bug: #1802815

Change-Id: I8c1356269277647490925e0181e2cd1dfca1fa4e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix listing checkpoints by plan error with FS bank

When listing checkpoints by plan with using FS bank,
it will fail with 'could not be found' error. The reason
is, in the bank, checkpoints by plan are stored as
"<bank_path>/karbor/indices/by-plan/<plan_id>/<project_id>
/<date>/<checkpoint>", but the file bank plugin only list
the <date> level, not include the checkpoint level. This
patch will fix it.

Closes-Bug: #1802815

Change-Id: I8c1356269277647490925e0181e2cd1dfca1fa4e

[{'created': '2018-10-27 05:42:56.000000000', 'message': 'Temporarily commenting broken tests

This commit comments out tests that are not functional as init file
from the directory is missing. A bug describing this has been
raised [1].
This is a temporary change which can be done undo once bug is
resolved, hence it will help other patches to merge that are
adding code in same directory by passing gate.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/masakari/+bug/1799634

Change-Id: I8c9d3b066e369d1b9d60652d813bc4788222bd12
'}]
commit_message:
Temporarily commenting broken tests

This commit comments out tests that are not functional as init file
from the directory is missing. A bug describing this has been
raised [1].
This is a temporary change which can be done undo once bug is
resolved, hence it will help other patches to merge that are
adding code in same directory by passing gate.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/masakari/+bug/1799634

Change-Id: I8c9d3b066e369d1b9d60652d813bc4788222bd12

commit_message:
Move default values to defaults

The os specific variables are overriding the provided vars so we should
only define things that should not be overridable because they are OS
specific (service names, config file locations, etc)

Change-Id: I2af49137d91c34eeb68353d7438a5ee09c8166c9
Closes-Bug: #1802538

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-11 08:07:38.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor action execution checker without using scheduler

* Removed using scheduler from action execution heartbeat checker
  in favor of regular threads.
* Added the new config options "batch_size" under [action_heartbeat]
  group to limit a number of action executions being processed during
  one iteration the checker.
* Added a test checking that an action execution is automatically
  failed by the heartbeat checker.

Closes-Bug: #1802065
Change-Id: I18c0c2c3159b9294c8af96c93c65a6edfc1de1a1
(cherry-picked from commit 2d74e6ebacf29379850d29bbe9317e930ff2da99)
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor action execution checker without using scheduler

* Removed using scheduler from action execution heartbeat checker
  in favor of regular threads.
* Added the new config options "batch_size" under [action_heartbeat]
  group to limit a number of action executions being processed during
  one iteration the checker.
* Added a test checking that an action execution is automatically
  failed by the heartbeat checker.

Closes-Bug: #1802065
Change-Id: I18c0c2c3159b9294c8af96c93c65a6edfc1de1a1
(cherry-picked from commit 2d74e6ebacf29379850d29bbe9317e930ff2da99)

issues.

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I3aa2e04bbe4d23053a05f5c734f366edfeb3c0bb
Closes-Bug:#1801830

commit_message:
Update zuul jobs: add freezer-tempest-basic-sql job

Add feezer-tempest-basic-sql job as a check/gate test in
freezer-tempest-plugin project.
The freezer-tempest-basic-sql job will use sqlalchemy as
db backend in freezer-api.

Change-Id: I3c7f729d112b2a66442454c794e54011bbab3243

It's a duplicate of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614291/"}, {'account_id': 26775, 'date': '2018-11-12 00:32:55.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-05 11:57:48.000000000', 'message': 'Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.
Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.
More details can be found in this mailing list post:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: I13a9e32d60b93a3bd83d5bee8fbfdb6a62972e2b
'}]
commit_message:
Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.
Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.
More details can be found in this mailing list post:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: I13a9e32d60b93a3bd83d5bee8fbfdb6a62972e2b

I8e5371cbc94e9a803ea5e64ae94aca293b834c73, add it as a new panel.

Use the tooltip sort from I931419f832b6fd4a537431e34c099e5f2884d4c2 on
the run_all runtimes.  Rename to be clearer.

Change-Id: I1a75f5dcfb12417b4de2756f7688a5da9ed57e4b

commit_message:
Add test coverage to manage existing flow

We're almost missing unit tests for manage_existing functionality. The
cinder.volume.flows.manager.manage_existing module has only ~37% of
coverage, manage_existing_snapshot 61%.
cinder.volume.flows.api.manage_existing also has ~58%.

Change-Id: I28c1d70e5a53d7420e3eb52573d1d6fff474b635
Partial-Bug: #1599140

[{'created': '2018-11-06 13:12:12.000000000', 'message': 'Expose the Libvirt cpu_model and cpu_model_extra_flags options

Being able to set cpu_mode to "custom" is nice but doesn't do us
much good if users then have to resort to nova_nova_conf_overrides
to set cpu_model and/or cpu_model_extra_flags.

Instead, honor nova_cpu_model and nova_cpu_model_extra_flags variable.
Also add a release note saying that for those users who did previously
set these flags via nova_nova_conf_overrides, they should move
those bits to the newly understood variables.

Change-Id: I889e70826c5c631b86305b512b86fba2b89521b4
(cherry picked from commit 58bad8e6b11931ee09fdc0bec07e426d911dac07)
'}]
commit_message:
Expose the Libvirt cpu_model and cpu_model_extra_flags options

Being able to set cpu_mode to "custom" is nice but doesn't do us
much good if users then have to resort to nova_nova_conf_overrides
to set cpu_model and/or cpu_model_extra_flags.

Instead, honor nova_cpu_model and nova_cpu_model_extra_flags variable.
Also add a release note saying that for those users who did previously
set these flags via nova_nova_conf_overrides, they should move
those bits to the newly understood variables.

Change-Id: I889e70826c5c631b86305b512b86fba2b89521b4
(cherry picked from commit 58bad8e6b11931ee09fdc0bec07e426d911dac07)

during bootstrap-ansible.  Set to false by default in
the bootstrap-ansible script and can be enabled with

(cherry picked from commit 8fbd1cbeaa9b35615163a5c7414f0abf0172d50c)
'}]
commit_message:
Adds option to enable ARA plugin install

Adds the option to enable ARA callback plugin install
during bootstrap-ansible.  Set to false by default in
the bootstrap-ansible script and can be enabled with
the SETUP_ARA variable.  In the gate-check-commit,
installation is set to enabled by default.

Change-Id: I5eb4285100207a8b8808b5000261f70c89c69de2
(cherry picked from commit 8fbd1cbeaa9b35615163a5c7414f0abf0172d50c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-08 18:41:10.000000000', 'message': 'octavia container network address pool

octavia provider network address pool is incorrectly identified
by net_name field of a provider network

.. code-block:: yaml

     - network:
        container_bridge: "br-lbaas"
        container_type: "veth"
        container_interface: "eth14"
        host_bind_override: "eth14"
        ip_from_q: "octavia"
        type: "flat"
        net_name: "octavia"
        group_binds:
          - neutron_linuxbridge_agent
          - octavia-worker
          - octavia-housekeeping
          - octavia-health-manager

In the example ip_from_q and net_name confusingly have the same
value octavia. However ip_from_q refers to cidr_network i.e. address pool
and net_name refers to physical network.

container_network name "octavia_address" comes from ip_from_q value.

Change-Id: Ibbe4636e9b92f2967cbf89a585b8c84a8a56668c
(cherry picked from commit 4bed7d3410c1eee461c54d175b0838102f1e9572)
'}]
commit_message:
octavia container network address pool

octavia provider network address pool is incorrectly identified
by net_name field of a provider network

.. code-block:: yaml

     - network:
        container_bridge: "br-lbaas"
        container_type: "veth"
        container_interface: "eth14"
        host_bind_override: "eth14"
        ip_from_q: "octavia"
        type: "flat"
        net_name: "octavia"
        group_binds:
          - neutron_linuxbridge_agent
          - octavia-worker
          - octavia-housekeeping
          - octavia-health-manager

In the example ip_from_q and net_name confusingly have the same
value octavia. However ip_from_q refers to cidr_network i.e. address pool
and net_name refers to physical network.

container_network name "octavia_address" comes from ip_from_q value.

Change-Id: Ibbe4636e9b92f2967cbf89a585b8c84a8a56668c
(cherry picked from commit 4bed7d3410c1eee461c54d175b0838102f1e9572)

[{'created': '2018-10-16 01:59:36.000000000', 'message': "Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: Ibe24ef6fb5aafd40d010e55aa20f0106bde58fe0
Story: #2004073
Task: #27414
"}]
commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: Ibe24ef6fb5aafd40d010e55aa20f0106bde58fe0
Story: #2004073
Task: #27414

commit_message:
Clarify scope of new projects

Now that we have the OpenStack project map, it is clear that our
description of the required scope for new projects really only
encompasses the main 'OpenStack' bucket on the map, when we have in
practice included several other classes of projects and always intended
to continue doing so.

https://www.openstack.org/assets/software/projectmap/openstack-map.pdf

This change documents the allowed purposes of new projects, using the
categories defined in the project map to describe them.

Change-Id: I02e91254fea83acbdb694dffefc7d864f0bad105

commit_message:
Don't depend on string interning

Use '!=' instead of 'is not' to compare strings.

In practice, short strings that appear in the source code are interned
in CPython, but this is implementation-specific.

Change-Id: If3f305c2d647fcd7515cb0a326a30f4eda93acd3

messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-30 16:16:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-10-30 21:14:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2018-11-01 05:01:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2018-11-11 08:22:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-11-11 08:25:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-30 16:16:29.000000000', 'message': 'Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This is covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: Ic940cee100f4fe00521ba0559107b89ed82a25a0
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This is covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: Ic940cee100f4fe00521ba0559107b89ed82a25a0
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add batch size for integrity checker

* Added the new property 'execution_integrity_check_batch_size'
  under the [engine] group to limit the number of task executions
  that the integrity checker may process during one iteration.

Closes-Bug: #1801876
Change-Id: I3c5074c45c476ebff109617cb15d56c54575dd4f
(cherry picked from commit 3b4136ff1eb27472cb6d2ee4d1603e2b92f22ac9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-15 13:47:40.000000000', 'message': 'Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: Iafb8b8b7ad80040d7aacd06cd2a66055f0337069
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: Iafb8b8b7ad80040d7aacd06cd2a66055f0337069
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:52:16.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ie123f2071e8ae3548490e640b07b32957bdb2204
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ie123f2071e8ae3548490e640b07b32957bdb2204
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add batch size for integrity checker

* Added the new property 'execution_integrity_check_batch_size'
  under the [engine] group to limit the number of task executions
  that the integrity checker may process during one iteration.

Closes-Bug: #1801876
Change-Id: I3c5074c45c476ebff109617cb15d56c54575dd4f

commit_message:
Use correct package manager at DLRN

Looks like we where using yum at fedora28 job at build-test-packages, we
need to generalize code at build-test-package so it works with fedora
too.

Also install-build-repo was trying to use yum.

Change-Id: I8cea39a9923e23c5f0fceb895a1efe4cb8ec395d
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/319?kanban-status=1447275

commit_message:
Add heat-status upgrade check command framework

This adds basic framework for heat-status upgrade
check commands. For now it has only "check_placeholder"
check implemented.
Real checks can be added to this tool in the future.

Change-Id: I83629184b49a6cf91928df702db23156433d99f6
Story: 2003657
Task: 26131

subject: Change __all__ list to tuple
messages:
[{'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2018-11-07 22:40:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2018-11-07 22:41:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Should be showing up in previous pep8 runs, but this is the warning message I was seeing:

./keystone/receipt/__init__.py WARNING: __all__ is defined as a list, this means pep257 cannot reliably detect contents of the __all__ variable, because it can be mutated. Change __all__ to be an (immutable) tuple, to remove this warning. Note, pep257 uses __all__ to detect which definitions are public, to warn if public definitions are missing docstrings. If __all__ is a (mutable) list, pep257 cannot reliably assume its contents. pep257 will proceed assuming __all__ is not mutated.
./keystone/receipt/providers/fernet/__init__.py WARNING: __all__ is defined as a list, this means pep257 cannot reliably detect contents of the __all__ variable, because it can be mutated. Change __all__ to be an (immutable) tuple, to remove this warning. Note, pep257 uses __all__ to detect which definitions are public, to warn if public definitions are missing docstrings. If __all__ is a (mutable) list, pep257 cannot reliably assume its contents. pep257 will proceed assuming __all__ is not mutated.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-11-08 14:33:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

How did you find this? Can we fix our pep8 tests so this warning becomes an error?'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-11-09 02:11:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

seems flake8 doesn't support treat warning as error. Then one way is to handle it in zuul-jobs I guess."}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2018-11-11 01:00:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> How did you find this? Can we fix our pep8 tests so this warning
 > becomes an error?

It just showed up for me when I ran pep8 and I looked at a random change's logs and it appeared there as well."}]

commit_message:
Change __all__ list to tuple

Currently pep257 is throwing a warning for the pep8 check with
an error that __all__ is defined as a list instead of an
immutable tupel. This changes both instances of a list to a
tuple and the warning message is no longer emitted.

Change-Id: Ia7c3f0ad99ecf0e1db4ff4165beed0d0ef09bf58
