revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-01 16:18:01.000000000', 'message': "Run Mistral workflow to make temporary Swift URLs on upgrade

The create_swift_backup_container_plan workflow was getting run
on overcloud deploy but not upgrade because it was called only
on the task split for the clone_git_repo task. This patch ensures
it is run regardless of if the call to clone_git_repo is necessary.
The create_swift_backup_container_plan workflow is used by Ceph and
Swift so in theory this was a bug for Swift upgrades too.

Also, updates rename_ceph_ansible_fetch_directory.yaml's notify_zaqar
task to send a meaningful message, as previously the workflow failed
because it tried to reference a variable as if it were a task.

Change-Id: Ifab82c9a5b0a206c14ae7976d2c1c7f0e9fa3d9d
Closes-Bug: #1799945
"}, {'created': '2018-11-06 13:41:52.000000000', 'message': "Run Mistral workflow to make temporary Swift URLs on upgrade

The create_swift_backup_container_plan workflow was getting run
on overcloud deploy but not upgrade because it was called only
on the task split for the clone_git_repo task. This patch ensures
it is run regardless of if the call to clone_git_repo is necessary.
The create_swift_backup_container_plan workflow is used by Ceph and
Swift so in theory this was a bug for Swift upgrades too.

Also, updates rename_ceph_ansible_fetch_directory.yaml's notify_zaqar
task to send a meaningful message, as previously the workflow failed
because it tried to reference a variable as if it were a task.

Change-Id: Ifab82c9a5b0a206c14ae7976d2c1c7f0e9fa3d9d
Closes-Bug: #1799945
(cherry picked from commit d1619ed9eac7ebbf8d8efae1476e1981d0a980e4)
"}]
commit_message:
Run Mistral workflow to make temporary Swift URLs on upgrade

The create_swift_backup_container_plan workflow was getting run
on overcloud deploy but not upgrade because it was called only
on the task split for the clone_git_repo task. This patch ensures
it is run regardless of if the call to clone_git_repo is necessary.
The create_swift_backup_container_plan workflow is used by Ceph and
Swift so in theory this was a bug for Swift upgrades too.

Also, updates rename_ceph_ansible_fetch_directory.yaml's notify_zaqar
task to send a meaningful message, as previously the workflow failed
because it tried to reference a variable as if it were a task.

Change-Id: Ifab82c9a5b0a206c14ae7976d2c1c7f0e9fa3d9d
Closes-Bug: #1799945
(cherry picked from commit d1619ed9eac7ebbf8d8efae1476e1981d0a980e4)

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-10-01 19:51:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-10-01 19:51:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-10-01 21:48:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-10-02 20:30:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Grenade is unhappy:

http://logs.openstack.org/60/606160/4/check/grenade-heat/7f1a417/logs/grenade.sh.txt.gz#_2018-10-01_23_21_49_100

It looks like this is because the stevedore endpoints registered in setup.cfg are now registered twice after the upgrade.

Not sure what the correct fix is here. Presumably with proper package management this would be a non-issue? So we should just clean up the old dist-info directory in the grenade job?'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-10-02 21:10:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Grenade is unhappy:
 > 
 > http://logs.openstack.org/60/606160/4/check/grenade-heat/7f1a417/logs/grenade.sh.txt.gz#_2018-10-01_23_21_49_100
 > 
 > It looks like this is because the stevedore endpoints registered in
 > setup.cfg are now registered twice after the upgrade.
 > 
 > Not sure what the correct fix is here. Presumably with proper
 > package management this would be a non-issue? So we should just
 > clean up the old dist-info directory in the grenade job?

Yeah, uninstalling the old package before installing the new one should do it. We are updating all Python projects to publish artifacts to PyPI. The
name "heat" is already taken there by another project, and they have
rejected our request to claim the name. We therefore need to change the
dist name used to package heat. We have some other projects publishing
using an "openstack-" prefix, so I propose using the name
"openstack-heat". This will not change the imports or anything else
about how the code works, just how it is packaged.

commit_message:
change the dist name to 'openstack-heat'

We are updating all Python projects to publish artifacts to PyPI. The
name "heat" is already taken there by another project, and they have
rejected our request to claim the name. We therefore need to change the
dist name used to package heat. We have some other projects publishing
using an "openstack-" prefix, so I propose using the name
"openstack-heat". This will not change the imports or anything else
about how the code works, just how it is packaged.

Add a grenade plugin for upgrading between the packages with different
names so that we can clean up the old version of the code and avoid
discovering the heat plugins multiple times in different locations.

Change-Id: I59b55cffd9e648f842eb286b936f09c5b55a76db
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: An execution hangs in the RUNNING state after rerun
messages: [{'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-11-10 14:02:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-11-10 14:18:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-11-10 16:36:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-10 14:02:20.000000000', 'message': 'An execution hangs in the RUNNING state after rerun

When we rerun an execution we must create the "_check_and_complete"
delayed calls for all parent workflows. The problem was that we created
the delayed call only for the rerun execution and its parent.

Recursive rerun was extracted in the separated function. Because we
need to execute some additional operations, for example, create delayed
call for every a rerun execution.

Closes-Bug: #1792451
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>
(cherry-picked from commit 041f3bd35c4f438c27087f5b48784055ae75f1c8)

Change-Id: I64de0c09bbe63401edead2f3ada5859b1db4a771
'}]
commit_message:
An execution hangs in the RUNNING state after rerun

When we rerun an execution we must create the "_check_and_complete"
delayed calls for all parent workflows. The problem was that we created
the delayed call only for the rerun execution and its parent.

Recursive rerun was extracted in the separated function. Because we
need to execute some additional operations, for example, create delayed
call for every a rerun execution.

Closes-Bug: #1792451
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>
(cherry-picked from commit 041f3bd35c4f438c27087f5b48784055ae75f1c8)

Change-Id: I64de0c09bbe63401edead2f3ada5859b1db4a771

subject: Simplify workflow and join completion logic
messages: [{'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-11-10 12:46:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-11-10 12:46:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-11-10 14:07:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-11-10 14:19:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-10 12:46:15.000000000', 'message': "Simplify workflow and join completion logic

* action_queue module is replaced with the more generic
  post_tx_queue module that allows to register operations that must
  run after the main DB transaction associated with processing a
  workflow event such as completing action.
* Instead of calling workflow completion check from all places
  where task may possibly complete, Mistral now registers a post
  transactional operation that runs after the main DB transaction
  (to make sure at least one needed consistent DB read) right
  inside the task completion logic. It reduces clutter significantly.
* Workflow completion check is now registered only if the just
  completed task may lead to workflow completion, i.e. if it's the
  last one in a workflow branch.
* Join now checks delayed calls to reduce a number of join
  completion checks created with scheduler and also uses post
  transactional queue for that.

Closes-Bug: #1801872
Change-Id: I90741d4121c48c42606dfa850cfe824557b095d0
(cherry picked from commit 80a1bed67b85543f4511b0eb5fb83464d4f9901e)
"}, {'created': '2018-11-10 14:07:19.000000000', 'message': "Simplify workflow and join completion logic

* action_queue module is replaced with the more generic
  post_tx_queue module that allows to register operations that must
  run after the main DB transaction associated with processing a
  workflow event such as completing action.
* Instead of calling workflow completion check from all places
  where task may possibly complete, Mistral now registers a post
  transactional operation that runs after the main DB transaction
  (to make sure at least one needed consistent DB read) right
  inside the task completion logic. It reduces clutter significantly.
* Workflow completion check is now registered only if the just
  completed task may lead to workflow completion, i.e. if it's the
  last one in a workflow branch.
* Join now checks delayed calls to reduce a number of join
  completion checks created with scheduler and also uses post
  transactional queue for that.

Closes-Bug: #1801872
Change-Id: I90741d4121c48c42606dfa850cfe824557b095d0
"}]
commit_message:
Simplify workflow and join completion logic

* action_queue module is replaced with the more generic
  post_tx_queue module that allows to register operations that must
  run after the main DB transaction associated with processing a
  workflow event such as completing action.
* Instead of calling workflow completion check from all places
  where task may possibly complete, Mistral now registers a post
  transactional operation that runs after the main DB transaction
  (to make sure at least one needed consistent DB read) right
  inside the task completion logic. It reduces clutter significantly.
* Workflow completion check is now registered only if the just
  completed task may lead to workflow completion, i.e. if it's the
  last one in a workflow branch.
* Join now checks delayed calls to reduce a number of join
  completion checks created with scheduler and also uses post
  transactional queue for that.

Closes-Bug: #1801872

[{'created': '2018-10-23 15:41:30.000000000', 'message': 'Add volume backup import/export commands

This adds commands to import and export volume backup records so they
can be imported and restored on other Cinder instances or to the
original instance if the service or database has been lost and had to be
rebuilt.

I know this is a commonly used process by some users, so it would be
good to have this functionality in osc so they do not have to switch
clients.

More details about the export and import process can be found here:

https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/admin/blockstorage-volume-backups-export-import.html

Change-Id: Ic95f87b36a416a2b50cb2193fd5759ab59336975

commit_message:
Add volume backup import/export commands

This adds commands to import and export volume backup records so they
can be imported and restored on other Cinder instances or to the
original instance if the service or database has been lost and had to be
rebuilt.

I know this is a commonly used process by some users, so it would be
good to have this functionality in osc so they do not have to switch
clients.

More details about the export and import process can be found here:

https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/admin/blockstorage-volume-backups-export-import.html

Change-Id: Ic95f87b36a416a2b50cb2193fd5759ab59336975
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Refactor action execution checker without using scheduler

* Removed using scheduler from action execution heartbeat checker
  in favor of regular threads.
* Added the new config options "batch_size" under [action_heartbeat]
  group to limit a number of action executions being processed during
  one iteration the checker.
* Added a test checking that an action execution is automatically
  failed by the heartbeat checker.

Closes-Bug: #1802065
Change-Id: I18c0c2c3159b9294c8af96c93c65a6edfc1de1a1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-26 17:05:40.000000000', 'message': "Wait for interface add/remove in test_add_remove_fixed_ip

Adding/removing ports (fixed IPs) to/from a server is an
asynchronous operation. The test_add_remove_fixed_ip test
was not waiting for the interface to be added to/removed from
the server, which means that it's possible for the server to
be getting deleted during tearDown before the removeFixedIp
operation has completed and will end up failing in the
nova-compute service. That failure wouldn't cause the test
to fail, however, since the test wasn't waiting for the
operation to complete at all.

This adds code to wait for the added fixed IP to show up
on the server and for the removed fixed IP to be removed
from the server's list of addresses.

Change-Id: I10a34fb12b595400fc15d935070f130c8e3d3963
Closes-Bug: #1794558
"}, {'created': '2018-09-27 19:41:11.000000000', 'message': "Wait for interface add/remove in test_add_remove_fixed_ip

was not waiting for the interface to be added to/removed from
the server, which means that it's possible for the server to
be getting deleted during tearDown before the removeFixedIp
operation has completed and will end up failing in the
nova-compute service. That failure wouldn't cause the test
to fail, however, since the test wasn't waiting for the
operation to complete at all.

This adds code to wait for the added fixed IP to show up
on the server and for the removed fixed IP to be removed

commit_message:
Wait for IP add/remove in test_add_remove_fixed_ip

Adding/removing fixed IPs to/from a server is an
asynchronous operation. The test_add_remove_fixed_ip test
was not waiting for the fixed IP to be added to/removed from
the server, which means that it's possible for the server to
be getting deleted during tearDown before the removeFixedIp
operation has completed and will end up failing in the
nova-compute service. That failure wouldn't cause the test
to fail, however, since the test wasn't waiting for the
operation to complete at all.

This adds code to wait for the added fixed IP to show up
on the server and for the removed fixed IP to be removed
from the server's list of addresses. Furthermore, the test
is changed to specifically remove the fixed IP that was
added.

Change-Id: I10a34fb12b595400fc15d935070f130c8e3d3963
Closes-Bug: #1794558

In ProcessTemplatesAction we reset the parameters cache for every single

Change-Id: I1d21d56bb032f446baa88b2927f29e1d864bf35d
"}]
commit_message:
Don't reset parameter cache in a loop

In ProcessTemplatesAction we reset the parameters cache for every single
template. It seems rather wasteful, let's just delete it once
beforehand.

Change-Id: I1d21d56bb032f446baa88b2927f29e1d864bf35d

subject: RGW haproxy backend return code can be 200 or 405
messages:
[{'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-10-30 09:30:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2463, 'date': '2018-10-30 10:01:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I ran into this issue and just confirmed that the fix is working fine in my environment.

Note to other reviewers: in inventory/group_vars/ceph-rgw.yml, we set "rgw_enable_apis: swift", and in that default configuration the haproxy check works fine even without this patch ‚Äî in that scenario, rgw does indeed return 405. However, in that same file we also set "rgw_s3_auth_use_keystone: true" ‚Äî which is useless when not enabling the S3 API, so the latter should definitely be a supported scenario.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-10-31 08:34:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-11-10 09:43:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-30 09:30:11.000000000', 'message': 'RGW haproxy backend return code can be 200 or 405

RGW Swift endpoint will return a 405 to httpchk.
RGW S3 endpoint will return a 200 to httpchk.

Change-Id: Ie5a9379d0823b1cdcfd67bbecb9a29ca4f262e92
'}]
commit_message:
RGW haproxy backend return code can be 200 or 405

RGW Swift endpoint will return a 405 to httpchk.
RGW S3 endpoint will return a 200 to httpchk.

Change-Id: Ie5a9379d0823b1cdcfd67bbecb9a29ca4f262e92

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-09 02:40:49.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Fix getting services from keystone error

commit_message:
Fix getting services from keystone error

Now, karbor's fullstack is broken, it is because the
getting services operation in operationengine is broken.

Change-Id: Ibbb717f9a5ed78e0f2d56499a41ab312a47a5837

subject: An execution hangs in the RUNNING state after rerun
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-10 13:52:39.000000000', 'message': 'An execution hangs in the RUNNING state after rerun

When we rerun an execution we must create the "_check_and_complete"
delayed calls for all parent workflows. The problem was that we created
the delayed call only for the rerun execution and its parent.

Recursive rerun was extracted in the separated function. Because we
need to execute some additional operations, for example, create delayed
call for every a rerun execution.

Change-Id: I530094e916daf25bb9c672c445afa980ad4311ae
Closes-Bug: #1792451
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>
(cherry-picked from commit 041f3bd35c4f438c27087f5b48784055ae75f1c8)
'}]
commit_message:
An execution hangs in the RUNNING state after rerun

When we rerun an execution we must create the "_check_and_complete"
delayed calls for all parent workflows. The problem was that we created
the delayed call only for the rerun execution and its parent.

Recursive rerun was extracted in the separated function. Because we
need to execute some additional operations, for example, create delayed
call for every a rerun execution.

Change-Id: I530094e916daf25bb9c672c445afa980ad4311ae
Closes-Bug: #1792451
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>
(cherry-picked from commit 041f3bd35c4f438c27087f5b48784055ae75f1c8)

[{'created': '2018-11-06 21:05:27.000000000', 'message': 'Adds option to enable ARA plugin install

Adds the option to enable ARA callback plugin install
during bootstrap-ansible.  Set to false by default in
the bootstrap-ansible script and can be enabled with
the SETUP_ARA variable.  In the gate-check-commit,
installation is set to enabled by default.

Change-Id: I5eb4285100207a8b8808b5000261f70c89c69de2
(cherry picked from commit 8fbd1cbeaa9b35615163a5c7414f0abf0172d50c)
'}]
commit_message:
Adds option to enable ARA plugin install

Adds the option to enable ARA callback plugin install
during bootstrap-ansible.  Set to false by default in
the bootstrap-ansible script and can be enabled with
the SETUP_ARA variable.  In the gate-check-commit,
installation is set to enabled by default.

Change-Id: I5eb4285100207a8b8808b5000261f70c89c69de2
(cherry picked from commit 8fbd1cbeaa9b35615163a5c7414f0abf0172d50c)

commit_message:
Fix resource tracker updates during instance evacuation

Current _update_usage_from_migrations code takes into account
only REBUILDING task state, while not handling properly rebuilding
spawn and rebuilding volume attachments. This can cause issues with
numa topologies or pci devices if several instances are being
evacuated and some of them begin evacuation prior to
update_available_resource periodic pass and others immediately after,
causing latter ones to claim e.g. already pinned cpus.

Closes-Bug: 1791075
Change-Id: I22aa680b00ae839c4acbc06cbfbc56dd27d5ab73

'}, {'created': '2018-11-06 03:53:49.000000000', 'message': "Simplify workflow and join completion logic

* action_queue module is replaced with the more generic
  post_tx_queue module that allows to register operations that must
  run after the main DB transaction associated with processing a
  workflow event such as completing action.
* Instead of calling workflow completion check from all places
  where task may possibly complete, Mistral now registers a post
  transactional operation that runs after the main DB transaction
  (to make sure at least one needed consistent DB read) right
  inside the task completion logic. It reduces clutter significantly.
* Workflow completion check is now registered only if the just
  completed task may lead to workflow completion, i.e. if it's the
  last one in a workflow branch.
* Join now checks delayed calls to reduce a number of join
  completion checks created with scheduler and also uses post
  transactional queue for that.

commit_message:
Simplify workflow and join completion logic

* action_queue module is replaced with the more generic
  post_tx_queue module that allows to register operations that must
  run after the main DB transaction associated with processing a
  workflow event such as completing action.
* Instead of calling workflow completion check from all places
  where task may possibly complete, Mistral now registers a post
  transactional operation that runs after the main DB transaction
  (to make sure at least one needed consistent DB read) right
  inside the task completion logic. It reduces clutter significantly.
* Workflow completion check is now registered only if the just
  completed task may lead to workflow completion, i.e. if it's the
  last one in a workflow branch.
* Join now checks delayed calls to reduce a number of join
  completion checks created with scheduler and also uses post
  transactional queue for that.

Closes-Bug: #1801872
Change-Id: I90741d4121c48c42606dfa850cfe824557b095d0

commit_message:
Correct swift replication service units

These pointed to the wrong binaries, and in the case of the object
replicator, a non-existant binary. The names of the binaries have
been checked here:

https://packages.ubuntu.com/bionic/all/swift-account/filelist
https://packages.ubuntu.com/bionic/all/swift-container/filelist
https://packages.ubuntu.com/bionic/all/swift-object/filelist

Change-Id: Ib8d4875d44130048c5a5d8b2973d6da3a4321abe

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-15 13:48:25.000000000', 'message': 'Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: Ic1c1ebb3e919b71bbc21e7ab4db1b8ad3a173faf
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: Ic1c1ebb3e919b71bbc21e7ab4db1b8ad3a173faf
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update legacy neutron L3HA tool support

This tool is still useful in some environments. In this
patch we ensure that if it is enabled, the openrc file
will be deployed on the host. We also remove the TODO
for it's removal.

Change-Id: I427765d0ff219b38bc3c86384e3807321db59dec
(cherry picked from commit bd728b82b7433da4df29f6477751d658b81f36b0)

commit_message:
zuul: Make openSUSE distro jobs voting

As discussed during the project meeting, the distro jobs for SUSE and
Ubuntu should only become voting during the stable branch stabilization.
openSUSE is working well in the Rocky release, so lets flip the switch
to voting

Change-Id: I420554b933e81919bdd8c69e3b47925441089cd4
Link: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/openstack_ansible_meeting/2018/openstack_ansible_meeting.2018-10-23-16.01.log.html#l-188

It's unnecessary and even not recommended to install network storage
related packages on all containers including api and scheduler one.

This change makes open-iscsi, nfs-utils and rpcbind required just
for cinder-volume and cinder-backup because it's obligatory when using
various backends.

It's not based on checking used volume drivers because most of them
relies on iSCSI and NFS.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/615869
Change-Id: If289b3e0b00a279afe3c13a628eed2bc4eacc0f7
Closes-Bug: #1704161
"}]
commit_message:
Install network storage related packages only on volume and backup containers

It's unnecessary and even not recommended to install network storage
related packages on all containers including api and scheduler one.

This change makes open-iscsi, nfs-utils and rpcbind required just
for cinder-volume and cinder-backup because it's obligatory when using
various backends.

It's not based on checking used volume drivers because most of them
relies on iSCSI and NFS.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/615869
Change-Id: If289b3e0b00a279afe3c13a628eed2bc4eacc0f7
Closes-Bug: #1704161

'}, {'created': '2018-11-05 12:42:07.000000000', 'message': 'Enable python-tempestconf support

This is an initial support for tempestconf tool.
Initially, tempestconf tool is being executed to generate the
tempestconf as it is, furthermore will be added the option to override
values, generate resources, hardcoded options, etc.
This is will be done in an incremental way in order to not have big
patches full of functionalities that might not be able to be fully
tested in one single patch.

commit_message:
Enable python-tempestconf support

This is an initial support for tempestconf tool.
Initially, tempestconf tool is being executed to generate the
tempestconf as it is, furthermore will be added the option to override
values, generate resources, hardcoded options, etc.
This is will be done in an incremental way in order to not have big
patches full of functionalities that might not be able to be fully
tested in one single patch.

Change-Id: I08cfa29361804de3bdb9077a7d8d2b8b417e50d8

commit_message:
Extend Zanata Pull with module option and more dashboard plugins

horizon-manage.py provides a module option to define different project
modules (horizon modules are default), so provide this option also here

Compile messages can be perform directly in horizon_lib_dir.
It's not required to go in each module dir, so removed this.
All messages will compiled now which takes insignificantly longer.

Change-Id: I82be90e722780d27bb0593575b8bfe5befe46686

commit_message:
Do not remove SSO callback template file

In distro installs, the SSO callback template file is created in
/etc/keystone. The 'Retrieve default configuration files from venv' task
copies it from there to a cache folder. If 'keystone_sp' is not provided
the file is being removed, which causes a subsequent run of the role to
fail.

Change-Id: I05df4c2a5f57c7437c008dd73a31b7eda2c3e281
(cherry picked from commit f66eca27d32fefc334d5b0f90c64f551e9b19116)

commit_message:
Update messaging notification configuration

This patch add the conditional inclusion of the notification
section of the service configuration. This ensures that oslo.messaging
notifications use the correct transport for deployments that have
separate rpc and notify messaging backends. For example, if the
transport_url is not provided in the notification section of the
service configuration, the transport_url specified in the default
section will be used instead.

This patch conditionally selects the notifier driver. The noop
driver will be selected when notification publishing is disabled.
The messagingv2 driver is selected when notification publishing is
enabled.

Change-Id: Ie967b281e15127bbf611aca557e99ac6b3d1cd4b
Closes-Bug: #1794320

commit_message:
Update messaging notification configuration

This patch add the conditional inclusion of the notification
section of the service configuration. This ensures that oslo.messaging
notifications use the correct transport for deployments that have
separate rpc and notify messaging backends. For example, if the
transport_url is not provided in the notification section of the
service configuration, the transport_url specified in the default
section will be used instead.

This patch conditionally selects the notifier driver. The noop
driver will be selected when notification publishing is disabled.
The messagingv2 driver is selected when notification publishing is
enabled.

Change-Id: I2b4c4a119fa300fb5b64eaaf947e3c688bdb6e84
Closes-Bug: #1794320

commit_message:

These development libs are required by some services to build and
start. This change adds the dev libs to the base image, which mirrors
the base lxc image .

subject: Allow rsyslog to log HAProxy locally
messages:
[{'account_id': 11069, 'date': '2018-08-01 04:58:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-08-01 10:56:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11069, 'date': '2018-08-01 14:16:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Reviewers,

After "sleeping on it" I realize that files/haproxy-logging.cfg is pretty open-ended (ie all local0.info gets written to /var/log/haproxy/haproxy.log and all remaining local0 gets discarded, whether related to haproxy or not), so it might be best to be more specific (eg "if $programname startswith 'haproxy' then /var/log/haproxy.log" as appears in Ubuntu's HAProxy package's rsyslog config).

Not that we weren't *implicitly* logging haproxy (and everything else logged to local0 and local1 facilities) to HAProxy logs before, but now that I'm proposing moving HAProxy's rsyslog config up from "99" to "10" we are going to discard everything local0 (after logging level info and above to /var/log/haproxy/haproxy.log) whether related to HAProxy or not and potentially before an associated rsyslog config file can save those log messages elsewhere (ie alphanumerically after "10-haproxy-local-logging.conf").

I'll defer to reviewers whether such detail(s) should affect this proposed change.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-08-01 14:55:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 11069, 'date': '2018-09-23 06:04:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11069, 'date': '2018-09-23 06:35:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

rsyslog configuration modified so that it only processes (ie logs and discards) haproxy log messages (ie those with application name starting with "haproxy" as part of syslog message tag) with a facility of local0 or local1, which is how we configure haproxy, so we should only be operating on our own haproxy log messages and not other applications' local0 and local1 log messages, especially now that our rsyslog process occurs so early (ie based on alphabetically sorted name of "10-haproxy-local-logging.conf").'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-09-23 20:38:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-09-25 09:41:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-11-10 09:48:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-01 04:58:15.000000000', 'message': "Allow rsyslog to log HAProxy locally

* Install haproxy-logging.cfg numerically before Ubuntu's
  /etc/rsyslog.d/49-haproxy.conf so its logging directives see HAProxy
  logs before they are discarded by 49-haproxy.conf.
* Set owner of /var/log/haproxy to rsyslog's `syslog` user so rsyslog
  can write to it on Ubuntu.

Change-Id: Ic259abc281619ba5ee8f020ac68373858a06e94d
Closes-Bug: #1783886
"}, {'created': '2018-09-23 06:04:24.000000000', 'message': "Allow rsyslog to log HAProxy locally

* Install haproxy-logging.cfg numerically before Ubuntu's
  /etc/rsyslog.d/49-haproxy.conf so its logging directives see HAProxy
  logs before they are discarded by 49-haproxy.conf.
* Set owner of /var/log/haproxy to rsyslog's `syslog` user so rsyslog
  can write to it on Ubuntu.
* Limit HAProxy-related rsyslog processing to HAProxy log messages
  instead of any/all log messages with the local0 or local1 facility
  and assuming HAProxy is the only application using those facilities.

Change-Id: Ic259abc281619ba5ee8f020ac68373858a06e94d
Closes-Bug: #1783886
"}]
commit_message:
Allow rsyslog to log HAProxy locally

* Install haproxy-logging.cfg numerically before Ubuntu's
  /etc/rsyslog.d/49-haproxy.conf so its logging directives see HAProxy
  logs before they are discarded by 49-haproxy.conf.
* Set owner of /var/log/haproxy to rsyslog's `syslog` user so rsyslog
  can write to it on Ubuntu.
* Limit HAProxy-related rsyslog processing to HAProxy log messages
  instead of any/all log messages with the local0 or local1 facility
  and assuming HAProxy is the only application using those facilities.

Change-Id: Ic259abc281619ba5ee8f020ac68373858a06e94d
Closes-Bug: #1783886

commit_message:
Fix multiple-nic sample template

Routes where only added to the External and Tenant interface.
This adds the routes also in the section setting up the nets
that are not External or Tenant

Closes-Bug: #1801916
Change-Id: Iec55e0c4ba27dc9a0003693850301804355433cc

commit_message:
Ensure libpython is included in base container builds

the python libs are required to start uwsgi services and because the
container images are so minimal the basic libs need to be installed.

Change-Id: I01cf4222c27bda3945d506fbc31a68bc717d480e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 209b7e3b5279ba40e4efed89b980a9f0efcc01f7)

subject: Do not disable caching for apt when http proxies are configured
messages:
[{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-11-02 21:43:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-11-04 20:39:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

This setting looks unrelated to the now-removed repo cache.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-11-07 10:00:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-11-07 10:10:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

sorry, misinterpreted'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-11-07 10:19:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)

Well - I also use my own local apt mirror, with my hosts apt config only pointing to that, therefore not needing to be aware of the proxy.

In the more general case a deployer may have no local mirror but use a proxy, and it is quite possible to configure a large cache as part of that proxy (with squid for example). In that case the squid config needs some extra rules to disable caching of certain files in the upstream repos otherwise a world of "hash sum mismatch" is unleashed. This setting quite possibly achieves the same thing but is very brutal and may well disable caching of packages as well as the package indexes?'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-11-07 12:22:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm of the opinion that disabling caching like that when using a proxy is too brutal too, and think perhaps what's done there should be opt-in, or should be left to the deployer to implement on their own and should not be in the purview of OSA."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-11-07 12:27:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah, I look back at this and I feel like we shouldn't be doing this on behalf of users?"}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-11-07 13:57:10.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

Fixing this up as discussed'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-11-07 13:57:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-11-07 14:28:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-11-07 14:39:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-11-07 15:40:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-11-07 15:41:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-11-07 15:41:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-11-10 09:42:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Change-Id: I62293c723353ffb986db1cddc5d0da20ae0df447
"}, {'created': '2018-11-07 13:57:18.000000000', 'message': 'Do not disable caching for apt when http proxies are configured

This patch removes code which detected http proxies being set in
environment variables, and inserted an apt configuration instructing
those proxies not to perform caching.

This lack of caching reduces the effectiveness of an http proxy which
has caching enabled - a common technique for increasing performance of
operating system installs without having to run a full mirror of
upstream repositories.

If a deployer is faced with a proxy server which in some way breaks
upstream package repository interactions, this no-cache setting can be
applied by the deployer as part of host preparation and will be
duplicated into containers by the OSA tooling.

Change-Id: I62293c723353ffb986db1cddc5d0da20ae0df447
'}, {'created': '2018-11-07 15:40:34.000000000', 'message': 'Do not disable caching for apt when http proxies are configured

Change-Id: I62293c723353ffb986db1cddc5d0da20ae0df447
'}, {'created': '2018-11-07 15:41:36.000000000', 'message': 'Do not disable caching for apt when http proxies are configured

This patch removes code which detected http proxies being set in
environment variables, and inserted an apt configuration instructing
those proxies not to perform caching.

This lack of caching reduces the effectiveness of an http proxy which
has caching enabled - a common technique for increasing performance of

If a deployer is faced with a proxy server which in some way breaks

Change-Id: I62293c723353ffb986db1cddc5d0da20ae0df447
'}]
commit_message:
Do not disable caching for apt when http proxies are configured

This patch removes code which detected http proxies being set in
environment variables, and inserted an apt configuration instructing
those proxies not to perform caching.

This lack of caching reduces the effectiveness of an http proxy which
has caching enabled - a common technique for increasing performance of
operating system installs without having to run a full mirror of
upstream repositories.

If a deployer is faced with a proxy server which in some way breaks
upstream package repository interactions, this no-cache setting can be
applied by the deployer as part of host preparation and will be
duplicated into containers by the OSA tooling.

Change-Id: I62293c723353ffb986db1cddc5d0da20ae0df447

[{'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-09-07 06:35:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-09-07 10:27:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The scenario004 job ran with python2-manila-tests-tempest-0.0.1 rather than 0.1.0 so the tempest tests failed because of no default share type - see http://logs.openstack.org/62/600662/1/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario004-multinode-oooq-container/ee0f72c/logs/undercloud/var/log/extra/rpm-list.txt.gz'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-09-07 15:30:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> The scenario004 job ran with python2-manila-tests-tempest-0.0.1
 > rather than 0.1.0 so the tempest tests failed because of no default
 > share type - see http://logs.openstack.org/62/600662/1/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario004-multinode-oooq-container/ee0f72c/logs/undercloud/var/log/extra/rpm-list.txt.gz

Check toci_type at runtime

To test ovb or multinode with the same reproducer,
selecting it at runtime instead of emit time helps a lot.

Change-Id: I744559bbc028b0850106ffce4804e34789949d8a

commit_message:
[Optimize] Ensure decorator's required parameters exist

Sometimes the custom decorator would expect some parameters exist
for usage, but it's possible that we would update the decorated
function, update or remove paramters. This patch adds a new decorator
'expects_func_args' to ensure custom decorator's required
parameters exist.

This comes from the identical method in Nova [1]

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/15f1caf98a46ba0ab3f8365075c564e89f06eef3/nova/utils.py#L746

Change-Id: I9f2bf77aa1784cfd6e85fca24bd126266e9e6458

(1 comment)

What about setting skip_file_src: '' in the FS. It will avoid using the master skip list, If anything fails in these tests we can keep the blacklist tests here itself."}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2018-11-02 11:12:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2018-11-02 11:14:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 >

If it is in skip list, it means there's a bug open and is being tracked, if we don't use the skip list here, where we are going to track down the issues? I don't think just remove the test from the list is enough, we might ending up in a mess
 
> the master skip list, If anything fails in these tests we can keep
 > the blacklist tests here itself."}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-11-02 11:43:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

 > list is enough, we might ending up in a mess
 > 
 > > the master skip list, If anything fails in these tests we can
 > keep
 > > the blacklist tests here itself.

Thanks for the comments,
The main reason regarding managing running without skip_list because we have tested the full tempest here in standalone: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/606046/20/config/general_config/featureset052.yml@26 and result is here http://logs.openstack.org/46/606046/20/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone/234d1ba/logs/tempest.html.gz But it resulted in taking too much time.

Managing blacklist in FS itself helps us to visualize what tests are failing in a particular deployment/scenario.

But you have raised a nice point here If a test fails we need it to skip list and we need to maintain a tracker for the skip list so that people can understand why it is skipped? What about extending test_black_regex from list to dict something like this:?
test_black_regex:
 - skip_test_name: [list of bugs]
It can also be useful for os_tempest role usecase in future?"}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2018-11-02 11:45:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

revoting on request, holding on the +A incase there are more comments but ultimately i expect we merge this and then revisit if the runtime becomes a problem. just feels like we're losing some of the standalone advantage with 2 hour runtimes rather than 1, but ofcourse we get a better tested result.

12:59 < arxcruz> marios: 1:35 min before if i recall correctly"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-06 15:24:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

So I don't want this on the standalone job because the whole point is to have a fast job.  We need basic smoke tests not full api tests.  Like I've said previously, we should replace fs020 with a standalone full run of tempest but I don't believe we should be running the full tempest suite in CI."}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2018-11-07 12:05:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-11-07 14:47:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Enable smoke tests and some tempest scenario on standalone

The standalone job is supposed to run quickly, and in order to keep the
quality of the tests, we are updating the list of tests being executed,
to include smoke tests, and and adding the top 3
scenarios, that will test network, storage and basic scenario. The idea
here is to keep tempest run below 1 hour.

Change-Id: I374f807ca68c4fd359395a5fea14dd302b33f0ea

commit_message:
Add masquerade option to ipa.yaml configuration

Without this the deployment doesn't work.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-06 21:22:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix cinder's default RBD backend_host

With patch [1] cinder's RBD backend_host no longer defaults to
'hostgroup'. The goal was to avoid adding any value to cinder's config.
Unfortunately, puppet-cinder supplies its own default value which is
inconsistent with TripleO's naming convention for cinder backends. This
patch adds the correct default value ($::hostname) for TripleO.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/608328

Change-Id: I4d3f4f5a10f0c38de483d68b7c0ed384aae2dcac
Related-Bug: #1796359
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cinder's default RBD backend_host

With patch [1] cinder's RBD backend_host no longer defaults to
'hostgroup'. The goal was to avoid adding any value to cinder's config.
Unfortunately, puppet-cinder supplies its own default value which is
inconsistent with TripleO's naming convention for cinder backends. This
patch adds the correct default value ($::hostname) for TripleO.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/608328

Change-Id: I4d3f4f5a10f0c38de483d68b7c0ed384aae2dcac
Related-Bug: #1796359

commit_message:
Add api ref link for import_backup

import_backup in backups_client.py has kwargs parameter,
but no api ref link for a full list of available parameters,
this is to add the link.

Change-Id: Ie30eb1ee76ee6521c5bdc9c8c3349a17ad6604b3

commit_message:
Fix designate db instantation

designate::central now requires designate::db
(I696745e2d57aade6cbb0fe89e334fddf1beaafdb), so we need to instantiate
the latter first.

[{'created': '2018-11-08 10:17:38.000000000', 'message': 'Disable OVN related services in ODL env file

ODL and OVN services are mutually exclusive and
leads to deployment failure when enabled on a role.
This patch sets OVN services to OS::Heat::None in
ODL env file to disable it whenever ODL is enabled.

Change-Id: Iaa757339f24fbadf51152326fe62f194c25e2384
(cherry picked from commit dcf0a9a1b95190d323a144a3893ba71c86ab7ba2)
(cherry picked from commit 95c10d1381f9f42afed7b765a520ad07e26d637d)
'}]
commit_message:
Disable OVN related services in ODL env file

ODL and OVN services are mutually exclusive and
leads to deployment failure when enabled on a role.
This patch sets OVN services to OS::Heat::None in
ODL env file to disable it whenever ODL is enabled.

Change-Id: Iaa757339f24fbadf51152326fe62f194c25e2384
(cherry picked from commit dcf0a9a1b95190d323a144a3893ba71c86ab7ba2)
(cherry picked from commit 95c10d1381f9f42afed7b765a520ad07e26d637d)

Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Closes-Bug:  #1801481

reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

This looks good Alex, thanks for working on it.
Reviewed:
    # TODO(aschultz): make the kolla-build branch aware
    - name: Generate kolla-build.conf
      template:
        src: templates/kolla-build.conf.j2
        dest: "{{ workspace }}/kolla-build.conf"
        mode: 0644
        force: yes

    - name: Run image build
      args:
        chdir: '{{ workspace }}'
      shell: |
        set -x
        source {{ workspace }}/venv/bin/activate
        TRIPLEO_COMMON_PATH="{{ openstack_git_root }}/tripleo-common"

        openstack overcloud container image build \
            --config-file $TRIPLEO_COMMON_PATH/container-images/overcloud_containers.yaml \
            --kolla-config-file {{ workspace }}/kolla-build.conf > {{ workspace }}/build.log 2> {{ workspace }}/build-err.log
        RESULT=$?
        exit $RESULT

http://logs.openstack.org/92/614392/31/check/tripleo-build-containers-centos-7/82617f1/logs/build.log.txt.gz

let's add some.

recheck'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-11-06 10:30:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

We have much more complicated scenarios than tripleo-repos works with - incl. upgrades, various promotion jobs with their stuff, etc, etc, just to see what we have in releases/ folder. I think tripleo-repos should be expanded much more for using it in CI, it's not ready."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-06 15:20:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Sagi, I don't have a simple way to just setup the repos for the build containers job. Additionally this is what we document for end users to actually use. I think it's time we actually put it to use in CI.  Yes it could be expanded but I'm not sure there are any additional needs for tripleo-repos right now that is not currently covered. Rather than saying it's not ready, can you point to specific features or instances that it is not currently ready provide?"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-06 15:22:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Additionally this is not looking to replace quickstart but rather provide the basics for simple jobs. Quickstart does not provide that today. Given that this works for the new jobs configurations, can you point to why I shouldn't use this for those jobs?  This is not intended to take the place of advanced quickstart configurations. But at some point I would hope to remove the awful repository code in quickstart with this but I am unsure what the requirements actually are."}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-11-06 16:13:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

Removing -1 as it's only for check jobs in patches and this could be handled by tripleo-repos"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-07 16:01:16.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from tripleo-repos-role to container-build-job'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-11-07 16:19:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-11-07 17:35:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-11-07 17:35:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

http://logs.openstack.org/92/614392/31/check/tripleo-build-containers-centos-7/82617f1/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-11-07_00_51_47_924342'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-11-09 14:46:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Role to install setup repos using tripleo-repos

For basic CI jobs, we should leverage tripleo-repos to do the yum
repository configurations for us.

Change-Id: I49ad22c44883b516bd9c8b76f71b7afeb24be20c

commit_message:
Fix runtime Ansible warnings

- deprecation of "static", using 'import_tasks' for static inclusions
or 'include_tasks' for dynamic inclusions.

- setup without value (ansbile yaml schema error)

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/611844
Change-Id: Idf2b3ec27d5c58d656b07a8b1274131281b7392c

commit_message:
Update tox minversion to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets

Change-Id: I97487d0fbe6999047be5ae487ccebea2bcf76def

subject: Assure standalone jobs are run when requirements are updated
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 8175, 'name': 'Rafael Folco', 'email': 'rfolco@redhat.com', 'username': 'rfolco'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios@redhat.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 9976, 'name': 'Ronelle Landy', 'email': 'rlandy@redhat.com', 'username': 'rlandy'}, {'_account_id': 10022, 'name': 'Gabriele Cerami', 'email': 'gcerami@redhat.com', 'username': 'panda'}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24162, 'name': 'Sorin Sb√¢rnea', 'display_name': 'zbr', 'email': 'ssbarnea@redhat.com', 'username': 'ssbarnea', 'status': 'do not feed the troll ü•ï'}, {'_account_id': 27898, 'name': 'Quique Llorente', 'email': 'ellorent@redhat.com', 'username': 'quiquell'}, {'_account_id': 29222, 'name': 'Natal Ng√©tal', 'email': 'hobbestigrou@erakis.eu', 'username': 'hobbestigrou'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-10-25 09:11:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2018-10-26 11:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Can you list some examples where changing those files impacts the workflow ?'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-10-26 11:07:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sure, have a look at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/596282/

Changing version of Ansible used can break... the world but at this moment we don't run any job about it. People are asking us to create fake DNM changes for testing such a change.

Shortly, I can put garbage in reqs.txt and it will probably pass CI because if this filter.

Any change made to this files can break the installation of the product, so there is no reason for keeping them out."}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-10-26 11:17:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Yep, we have to run tests on changing those files'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-10-26 11:42:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-10-26 17:36:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-10-26 19:37:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I need to review this a bit better but I'm not sure this is the right spot for the requirements update because most tripleo jobs this is not tested because packages.  This was there because the requirements updates would trigger tripleo jobs which was a waste"}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-10-27 17:40:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I'm not sure we change reqs file so often that it will create a load on CI, in addition when changing version of python package (like ansible for example) it's better to run most of jobs to be sure it didn't break something"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-10-29 13:56:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The only project this affects is tripleo-quickstart so it is better to adjust this there than globally.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-10-29 15:37:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Alex, please show me another tripleo based project where modifying reqs.txt does not impact the entire project?

Please note that I did not remove the test-requirements.txt from the ignore patterns, this is only about changing runtime reqs, and I think we should consider them important for any project.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-10-29 15:51:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The *tripleo* jobs use packages. The requirements.txt does nothing with packages. The only thing that it impacts is quickstart because that is pip installed. If I update requirements.txt in tripleo-heat-templates, python-tripleoclient, tripleo-common, the *tripleo* jobs are only impacted if the new requirement is missing from the package which is not automatically added.  This will not be picked up by this update.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-10-29 15:55:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Assuming that we want to do this only for tripleo-quickstart, how are we going to do it?

I suspect that this would require to copy the entire irrelevant-files section and hope that zuul will not merge it with the parent job one?'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-10-29 16:24:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

You could try seeing if files overrides irrelevant-files. I think it might. Honestly you only need one tripleo job on the requirements.txt update to prove that it doesn't break everything."}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-10-29 16:36:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is true, and that one is likely the standalone one.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-10-29 17:09:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-10-30 14:15:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-10-30 15:33:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2018-10-30 15:59:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-10-30 18:40:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1 Workflow-1

Is not working! Found zuul I need to rework it.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-10-31 14:22:14.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

clearing up the gate.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-11-01 16:33:56.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-11-08 20:39:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-11-08 23:59:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-11-09 08:55:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

I previously +2 but that was different (you were adding files). using the job inheritance with override makes sense even if more verbose'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2018-11-09 10:07:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-11-09 10:21:00.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from 613250 to oooq/standalone'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-11-09 14:19:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

In case someone does not believe that we use thse, check http://logs.openstack.org/50/613250/3/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone/a8c04a2/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-11-09_00_04_53_856352 --- see requirements being used?!'}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2018-11-09 14:29:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Removes: requirements.txt, setup.cfg and setup.py files from the
irrelevant list because any change made to this files can affect

Also these files are not often updated so there is no real extra
burden on CI for testing these.

This makes the need to create extra empty changeset for testing
changes made to these files.

Change-Id: I637b3da0a4beacadc63846eb4cd08d510bafd4ac

Removes: requirements.txt, setup.cfg and setup.py files from the
irrelevant list because any change made to this files can affect

Change-Id: I637b3da0a4beacadc63846eb4cd08d510bafd4ac

commit_message:
Assure standalone jobs are run when requirements are updated

Removes: requirements.txt, setup.cfg and setup.py files from the
irrelevant list because any change made to this files can affect
the functionality of the product in a critical way.

This makes the need to create extra empty changeset for testing
changes made to these files.

Change-Id: I637b3da0a4beacadc63846eb4cd08d510bafd4ac

commit_message:
Update fedora28 release file current dlrn hash

We have manually promote current-tripleo at fedora to a hash that has the
following fixes:
- python-tripleoclient: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614168/
- python-heat-agents: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/17216/

To search for hashes you can look at the fedora DLRN report [1] or do a
search with dlrn client.

[1] https://trunk.rdoproject.org/api-fedora-master/api/report.html

Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/293?kanban-status=1447275
Change-Id: I2c471724374da44eeddc4680b268bc362572ee27

commit_message:
Fix hiera condition in UndercloudCtlplaneNetworkDeployment

_run_command() returns the output of the command executed.
If the Neutron API is disabled it would return the string
'false' which is in fact True as far as python is concerned.

We also need a depends_on to ensure the link to hiera.yaml
created in extraconfig/post_deploy/undercloud_post.sh is
already in place.

Change-Id: Iec958a92433d3f671862422ac85bc78d7babc01d

commit_message:
Drop ssh-user from 'upgrade run' template.

`--ssh-user SSH_USER` option is deprecated and shoudn't be
used during Q->R upgrade, though it's still used during
`upgrade prepare/converge` calls.

Change-Id: I141d676d5314fe415043b97a8b472f8b789309ee
(cherry picked from commit 6411e5237d221986ef5dd69c1bccaf74ad0b8023)

commit_message:
Reduce unit testing changes required for emit_releases_file

When looking at recent edit of emit_releases_file.py it seems that the
amount of manual unit test changes required [1] is so high that it
might deter contributors and consume too much effort.

Much of the edited unit test data seems repetitive, so my rationale
here is that we can reduce the amount of data resulting in a small
loss of coverage but considerable reduction of required labor when
making emit_releases_file amendments.

The order of side effects for get_hash function was considered for the
test result, now we use a fixture that is backed up by a tuple to a
string dictionary to configure the mock, so the order is not important
anymore.

Co-Authored-By: Quique Llorente <ellorent@redhat.com>

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/606996/7/scripts/emit_releases_file/test_release_name.py

Change-Id: Ie573813a4916aeb1bb15b5aa38dc2a732586e8c2

There have two  elasticsearch drivers in freezer-api.
The freezer_api.storage.elasticv2.ElasticSearchEngineV2 is used now.
It is correct in doc.'}, {'account_id': 21387, 'date': '2018-11-02 02:14:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

could you please modify document according to this:
1)freezer-api v1:
  /etc/freezer/freezer-api.conf:
      [DEFAULT]
          enable_v1_api = True
	  [storage]
          driver = elasticsearch
          backend = elasticsearch
	  [elasticsearch]
          hosts = http://172.16.1.200:9200
          number_of_replicas = 0
          index = freezer

  /etc/freezer/scheduler.conf:
      [DEFAULT]
          enable_v1_api = True

   command: freezer --os-backup-api-version 1  job-list

2)freezer-api v2:
  /etc/freezer/freezer-api.conf:
      [DEFAULT]
          enable_v1_api = False
		  or
		  # enable_v1_api = False
	  [storage]
          driver = elasticsearch
          backend = elasticsearch
	  [elasticsearch]
          hosts = http://172.16.1.200:9200
          number_of_replicas = 0
          index = freezer

  /etc/freezer/scheduler.conf:
      [DEFAULT]
         enable_v1_api = False
		 or
         # enable_v1_api = False
thanks'}, {'account_id': 25562, 'date': '2018-11-02 11:08:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25562, 'date': '2018-11-02 15:38:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

[{'created': '2018-11-01 08:40:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the NetworkPolicy in multihost deployment

Add a new config option:
[kubernetes]
trusted_cidrs = []

If trusted_cidrs is empty list, the local IP CIDR will be used.

The pod in qinling namespace can only be accessed by the CIDRs
configured.

Change-Id: Iecc34c1be16851cc53afe2fca94c2bbf0fdf7988

commit_message:
Fix the NetworkPolicy in multihost deployment

Add a new config option, an example:
[kubernetes]
trusted_cidrs = 127.0.0.1/32,198.72.124.109/32

If trusted_cidrs is empty list, the local IP CIDR will be used.

The pod in qinling namespace can only be accessed by the CIDRs
configured.

Change-Id: Iecc34c1be16851cc53afe2fca94c2bbf0fdf7988
Story: 2004206
Task: 27715

commit_message:
This patch changes group membership of /var/log/mysql_logs directory.
It makes log files accesible for rsyslog daemon.

Change-Id: Id156037ad053b62036b5359f12eabbf54e7e1369
Closes-Bug: #1745442

commit_message:
Fix version details API does not return 200 OK

When use version details api http://ip/compute/v2 to get api details,
it does not return 200 OK, and the return value is empty.

This change is to correct the version details API URL.

Change-Id: I6befb4df6b688ae8c59671781c4e7b338a16462c
Closes-Bug: #1802247

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-09 14:19:32.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: change "Ignoring supplied device name" warning to info

This doesn't need to be a warning that only the operator sees
in the nova-compute logs. The operator can't do anything about
it since the REST API user is the one passing in a device name
when attaching a volume to their server. So let's just change
the warning to an info level message. We already have documentation
stating that the device parameter is ignored by some compute
drivers.

Change-Id: If2dd8d0a3992ccf4bd9aa01978b7c91897e2eb59
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: change "Ignoring supplied device name" warning to info

This doesn't need to be a warning that only the operator sees
in the nova-compute logs. The operator can't do anything about
it since the REST API user is the one passing in a device name
when attaching a volume to their server. So let's just change
the warning to an info level message. We already have documentation
stating that the device parameter is ignored by some compute
drivers.

Change-Id: If2dd8d0a3992ccf4bd9aa01978b7c91897e2eb59

subject: Add auto discover for ceph prometheus metrics
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-09 17:46:42.000000000', 'message': 'Add auto discover for ceph prometheus metrics

Add to elk_metrics_6x the capability to auto discover the ceph mgr
prometheus plugin metric port.  Pull ceph metrics from prometheus when
the plugin is enabled.

Change-Id: I530a99f42e396ba7b2cd2c1b3d587f528ef84242
'}]
commit_message:
Add auto discover for ceph prometheus metrics

Add to elk_metrics_6x the capability to auto discover the ceph mgr
prometheus plugin metric port.  Pull ceph metrics from prometheus when
the plugin is enabled.

Change-Id: I530a99f42e396ba7b2cd2c1b3d587f528ef84242

commit_message:
Add extra volume types to AIO

This change adds example volume types in AIO. It will allow tests to
enter code paths that create volume types and associate QoS specs.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/616376
Change-Id: I0cb77b1958e586e35458368ec00f4f167d031923

commit_message:
libvirt: Reduce calls to qemu-img during update_available_resource

I464bc2b88123a012cd12213beac4b572c3c20a56 introduced a second call to
``qemu-img`` that can easily be collapsed into one with the addition of
a new call within the disk_api.

Conflicts:
   nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

NOTE(s10): The conflict was due to not having change
Ic853743573aa0b74d5d2c5b8b47252b875d5f7ef in Queens.

Related-Bug: #1785827
Change-Id: Ibfd0527ed79f60282b542034d7cb97b424becba3
(cherry picked from commit d41ea9d87894111051b591d513cd046e5e357124)

commit_message:
Fix neutron endpoint mangling

If the endpoint has a v2.0 on it, we were double mangling it. Fix the
issue and add a test.

Change-Id: Ia73ea9ae15038a1aba3b46528d0c21f2ac028ec0
Story: 2004310
Task: 27877

Updated this according to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613305/1/nova/api/openstack/placement/objects/resource_provider.py@2758'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-10-26 09:04:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/613304/2 : SUCCESS in 2h 09m 01s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-10-26 20:13:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-09 20:43:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Cool. Discussed this with Eric in IRC also:

(2:30:51 PM) mriedem: how/where does the root_provider_uuid get set on a provider?
(2:30:58 PM) mriedem: i'm looking at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613304/
(2:31:06 PM) mriedem: and trying to figure out how that could happen - old computes?
(2:32:20 PM) mriedem: oh so if i create a resource provider but omit parent_provider_uuid, then it's automatically the root, right?
(2:32:23 PM) mriedem: b/c it doesn't have a parent
(2:33:02 PM) fried_rice: should be, yeah
(2:33:27 PM) fried_rice: I don't think you're allowed to set the root provider UUID on a provider. It happens automatically.
(2:33:39 PM) fried_rice: If you don't set the parent ID, the node is a root node, period.
(2:34:34 PM) mriedem: right so https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1799892
(2:34:35 PM) fried_rice: and yes, the test case in that patch is theoretically old computes, or manual diddling.
(2:34:35 PM) openstack: Launchpad bug 1799892 in OpenStack Compute (nova) "Placement API crashes with 500s in Rocky upgrade with downed compute nodes" [Undecided,New]
(2:34:58 PM) mriedem: any providers created before queens https://review.openstack.org/#/c/377138/ wouldn't have parent_provider_uuid or root_provider_id set
(2:35:16 PM) mriedem: and we apparently didn't have an online data migration to set the root_provider_uuid for existing providers...
(2:36:00 PM) mriedem: and at some point along the way to supported nested resource providers in the scheduler, allocation candidates assumes all providers have a root_provider_uuid set
(2:36:22 PM) fried_rice: we *do* have a data migration
(2:36:38 PM) fried_rice: We even set the root provider ID on reads if we find it unset
(2:37:06 PM) fried_rice: But the hole here may have been that we're looking at this particular provider in a place that doesn't have that migration thing going.
(2:39:24 PM) mriedem: oh i see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/377138/62/nova/objects/resource_provider.py@917
(2:39:33 PM) mriedem: yeah so when we get the provider, we migrate the data
(2:39:49 PM) mriedem: but maybe when getting allcoation candidates, we're going straight through the db rather than the objects
(2:39:56 PM) fried_rice: just so'}]

commit_message:
Add recreate test for bug 1799892

There are cases where ``root_provider_id`` of a resource provider is
set to NULL just after it is upgraded to the Rocky release. In such
cases getting allocation candidates raises a Keyerror.

This patch recreate that bug by simulating the situation by
inserting the records to the database directly.

Change-Id: Iaed912314f3e8fef2f46453a6bf12011702ae1dd
Related-Bug:#1799892

messages: [{'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-10-26 16:23:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-11-07 13:27:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11022, 'date': '2018-11-09 20:12:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-26 16:23:10.000000000', 'message': "Provide a Location on HTTP 300

To best adhere to the RFC2616, we should emit a Location header when
issuing an HTTP 300 to point to the preferred version. While we only
have a single version active it is 'v3'. In the future it should
always be the most recent set of CRUD. This location is strictly for
CRUD purposes and will lean on the WWW-Authentication URI to point
to the most correct AUTH uri.

Change-Id: Ibdd53f236a3c51d1aa23eac35dd595e2dae79ba6
closes-bug: #1230927
"}]
commit_message:
Provide a Location on HTTP 300

To best adhere to the RFC2616, we should emit a Location header when
issuing an HTTP 300 to point to the preferred version. While we only
have a single version active it is 'v3'. In the future it should
always be the most recent set of CRUD. This location is strictly for
CRUD purposes and will lean on the WWW-Authentication URI to point
to the most correct AUTH uri.

Change-Id: Ibdd53f236a3c51d1aa23eac35dd595e2dae79ba6
closes-bug: #1230927

commit_message:
Stop leaking quite so many connections

While investigating the failures when you move func tests to py3, I
noticed a whole bunch of

   ResourceWarning: unclosed <socket.socket ...>

noise. This should fix it.

While we're at it, make get_capabilities less stupid.

Change-Id: I3913e9334090b04a78143e0b70f621aad30fc642
Related-Change: I86d24104033b490a35178fc504d88c1e4a566628

commit_message:
Emit CADF notifications on authentication for invalid users

Emit CADF notifications on authentication when the user_name or the
user_id is invalid (UserNotFound raised). This closes a minor security
gap in notifications.

Change-Id: If8b49b5dc49a4b0670fb81a493f50c77df7b4362
closes-bug: #1537963

commit_message:
Update more info of vhost file

The federation document talks about the
vhost file to be changed when configuring
shibboleth. As a user it is difficult to
understand where the file is located and
when configuring through devstack no
vhost file of name *keystone.conf* exists.

Thus this patch adds more information regarding
vhost file for more understandability.

Change-Id: Ifb43e6532e8d388bfcfee64d36e43e5120aab4c5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-04 20:45:23.000000000', 'message': "Make scheduler.utils.setup_instance_group query all cells

To check affinity and anti-affinity policies for scheduling instances,
we use the RequestSpec.instance_group.hosts field to check the hosts
that have group members on them. Access of the 'hosts' field calls
InstanceGroup.get_hosts during a lazy-load and get_hosts does a query
for all instances that are members of the group and returns their hosts
after removing duplicates. The InstanceList query isn't targeting any
cells, so it will return [] in a multi-cell environment in both the
instance create case and the instance move case. In the move case, we
do have a cell-targeted RequestContext when setup_instance_group is
called *but* the RequestSpec.instance_group object is queried early in
compute/api before we're targeted to a cell, so a call of
RequestSpec.instance_group.get_hosts() will result in [] still, even
for move operations.

This makes setup_instance_group query all cells for instances that are
members of the instance group if the RequestContext is untargeted, else
it queries the targeted cell for the instances.

Closes-Bug: #1746863

 Conflicts:
	nova/objects/instance_group.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflict was from oslo_utils jsonutils not being
used in Queens.

Change-Id: Ia5f5a0d75953b1154a8de3e1eaa15f8042e32d77

commit_message:
Make scheduler.utils.setup_instance_group query all cells

To check affinity and anti-affinity policies for scheduling instances,
we use the RequestSpec.instance_group.hosts field to check the hosts
that have group members on them. Access of the 'hosts' field calls
InstanceGroup.get_hosts during a lazy-load and get_hosts does a query
for all instances that are members of the group and returns their hosts
after removing duplicates. The InstanceList query isn't targeting any
cells, so it will return [] in a multi-cell environment in both the
instance create case and the instance move case. In the move case, we
do have a cell-targeted RequestContext when setup_instance_group is
called *but* the RequestSpec.instance_group object is queried early in
compute/api before we're targeted to a cell, so a call of
RequestSpec.instance_group.get_hosts() will result in [] still, even
for move operations.

This makes setup_instance_group query all cells for instances that are
members of the instance group if the RequestContext is untargeted, else
it queries the targeted cell for the instances.

Closes-Bug: #1746863

Change-Id: Ia5f5a0d75953b1154a8de3e1eaa15f8042e32d77
(cherry picked from commit 14f4c502f92b10b669044e5069ac3b3555a42ee0)
(cherry picked from commit 3051a0d5d5639b451d6da5e9f490332399b18c54)
(cherry picked from commit ab939372cd0488a0a4e2a8a1764a42eff2e329c5)

commit_message:
Add support to kvm nested virt

This patch aims to provide the ability for the user
to enable nested kvm virtualization in a kvm compute node
through nova_nested_virt_enabled variable, which its defaults is False.

Change-Id: I64417221fb3d74453d979b7198a0e916e7f4dd23
(cherry picked from commit 72389a6c71811f47bd0e9484d727660291db135c)

commit_message:
Fix the checkPGs cronjob

Currently the cronjob is broken due to syntax and
permission issues.

Additionally move the cronjob from once a month to
every 15 minutes, and automatically disable the job
unless explicitly enabled.

Change-Id: Id72bdb286c805ccb0ea4e9fcf65fabca94a180dd

commit_message:
Nagios: Configuration updates

This moves to update the host used for the ceph health checks, as
we should be checking the ceph-mgr service directly for ceph
metrics instead of trying to curl the host directly.

This also changes the ceph_health_check to use the base-os
hostgroup instead of the placeholder ceph-mgr host group, as we're
just executing a simple check against the ceph-mgr service.

This also adds default configuration values for the
max_concurrent_checks (60) and check_workers (4) values instead
of leaving them at the defaults Nagios uses (0 and # cores,
respectively)

Change-Id: Ib4072fcd545d8c05d5e9e4a93085a8330be6dfe0

[{'created': '2018-11-09 15:15:03.000000000', 'message': 'Nagios: Update host check mechanism

This updates the Nagios image to use a tag that includes a fix for
the service discovery mechanism used for updating host checks.
After moving the Nagios chart to either run in shared or host PID
namespaces, the service discovery mechanism no longer worked due
to the plugin attempting to restart PID 1 instead of determining
the appropriate PID to restart.

For reference, see:
https://review.gerrithub.io/#/c/att-comdev/nagios/+/432205/

Change-Id: Ie01c3a93dd109a9dc99cfac5d27991583546605a
'}]
commit_message:
Nagios: Update host check mechanism

This updates the Nagios image to use a tag that includes a fix for
the service discovery mechanism used for updating host checks.
After moving the Nagios chart to either run in shared or host PID
namespaces, the service discovery mechanism no longer worked due
to the plugin attempting to restart PID 1 instead of determining
the appropriate PID to restart.

For reference, see:
https://review.gerrithub.io/#/c/att-comdev/nagios/+/432205/

Change-Id: Ie01c3a93dd109a9dc99cfac5d27991583546605a

commit_message:
Add wait functions to orchestration proxy

Senlin uses wait_for_status and wait_for_delete that were previously
provided in openstack.proxy.Proxy. This adds the functions removed from
openstack.proxy.Proxy to the orchestration proxy.

This change also reenables the orchestration functional test.

Change-Id: I70b478669951237bc290c66d4ae160ec21c655ac

commit_message:
Fix updating amphora images

The octavia_amp_image.yml playbook is not idempotent because it is
missing some conditional logic and uses an incorrect result variable
name for the `os_image_facts` module (albeit following the module
documentation).

This change also updates the use of the `id` key to the required
`name` key in the `os_image` module.

Also, the fact get and image deletion need to be done by the service
account, not the cloud admin account.

Finally, these tasks all have the same conditional, so we put them
all into a block.

Change-Id: I52e111fffe9a60c879c967c94a895ae272d98fcd
